title: Combo Auto Body Technician
description:
V&J Auto Body is a leading provider of exceptional auto body repair services, known for our cutting-edge technology, top-of-the-line equipment, and commitment to customer satisfaction. With over 40 years of success in the industry, we are proud to be a family-owned and operated business, serving Lindenhurst, New York, and the surrounding areas. Our mission is to provide our customers with transparent and high-quality auto body repairs, all while maintaining a safe and welcoming environment for our employees and clients.

As a Combo Auto Body Technician at V&J Auto Body, you will have the opportunity to join a team of passionate and skilled professionals who are dedicated to delivering exceptional results.

If you are a motivated and skilled Combo Body Technician who takes pride in delivering exceptional work, we invite you to join our team at V&J Auto Body. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer a positive work environment, opportunities for growth, and a chance to be part of a reputable and thriving automotive repair business.

**Responsibilities**

The Combo Auto Body Technician is a critical role at V&J Auto Body and is responsible for a variety of body repairs, ranging from light to medium.

Responsibilities include:

* Perform a variety of medium and light body repairs on vehicles, including metal straightening, panel replacement, and steel welding.
* Follow industry and manufacturer procedures diligently by adhering to the provided work order for each listed operation.
* Utilize provided technology and software to update vehicle repair status and document repair procedures executed
* Utilize industry-standard tools and equipment to complete repair work efficiently and to high-quality standards.
* Work collaboratively with other team members, including painters and detailers, to ensure a seamless repair process from start to finish.
* Adhere to company policies and procedures, as well as relevant safety guidelines, to ensure a safe working environment.
* Maintain a clean and organized work area, ensuring the safety and cleanliness of the shop at all times.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest automotive repair techniques and industry advancements through continuous learning and professional development.
* Other duties as assigned, including but not limited to: shop maintenance, shop projects, company initiatives, etc.

Requirements:

* 18 years or older
* High school diploma or equivalent; completion of a vocational or technical school program in auto body repair is preferred, but not required
* Proven experience as an auto body technician, 3+ years experience preferred
* Excellent knowledge of automotive repair techniques and industry best practices

title: Economic Empowerment Program English Instructor
description:
Position: **Economic Empowerment Program English Instructor**   
Status: Non-exempt, Part-Time  
Reports to: Economic Empowerment Program Coordinator  
Salary: $30.00 per hour

**The Korean-American Family Service Center, Inc. (KAFSC)** is a leading non-profit organization dedicated to assisting survivors of gender-based violence in the New York tri-state area. Our services include counseling, education, advocacy, and support, helping individuals to empower themselves and build safe, healthy relationships based on mutual respect and dignity. Annually, over 3,000 individuals benefit from our culturally sensitive, linguistically appropriate, and free services.

KAFSC is currently seeking a qualified candidate to join as an English Instructor for intermediate/advanced levels. This position involves teaching English language skills to program participants, facilitating learning, and ensuring a supportive educational environment. The ideal candidate should have computer proficiency, experience in teaching or training, and a passion for empowering individuals through education.

**About the role**

In this role, you will plan, prepare, and deliver structured and interactive lessons and ensure a high level of student satisfaction.  
Your key tasks will consist of, but not be limited to:

**Responsibilities:** 

* Develop lesson plans and deliver engaging and effective instruction tailored to basic, intermediate and advanced levels for English language learners.
* Adapt curriculum materials to meet the diverse learning needs of participants, ensuring comprehension and skill development.
* Monitor and assess participant progress, providing constructive feedback and support as needed.
* Collaborate with program coordinators to evaluate and enhance instructional methods and effectiveness.
* Maintain accurate records of attendance, assessments, and participant achievements.
* Assist in organizing program activities and events aimed at enhancing participant engagement and success.

**Qualifications:** 

* Bachelor’s degree in a related or equivalent field preferred.
* Previous experience in education or related fields is preferred.
* Willingness to work flexible hours, including some evenings as needed.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills.
* Personal integrity and ability to handle confidential and sensitive information.
* Understanding of New York City’s diversity and experience working with people of diverse backgrounds.
* Must be able to teach in-person.

title: Community Construction Liaison
description:
Queens, New York
SI Engineering, P.C. (SIE) is a full-service consulting engineering firm based in downtown Manhattan providing services in civil, structural, transportation engineering, bridge & facility inspection, construction management & inspection and lighting design. We are engaged in local community improvement projects to large, high-profile, multi-billion-dollar infrastructure projects with a strong reputation of delivering a wide range of projects for our clients in the public sector.


SIE is seeking a Community Construction Liaison for a Pedestrian Ramp project in Queens. This position would work closely with the New York City Department of Design and Construction (NYCDDC).  

  

Responsibilities:


* Notify city agencies and community stakeholders regarding infrastructure upgrades via physically distributed and electronic newsletters/advisories and weekly bulletins
* Document all community engagements and complaints
* Refer community to other agencies/resources when their issue is not related to the project
* Attend DDC Progress Meetings to update about various community concerns

Qualification & Skills:


* Bachelor’s degree preferred
* At least five years of experience as a Community Liaison in New York City
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Range:  

Expected salary range is $78,000 - $98,600 annually. Actual compensation will be dependent on the individual’s qualifications, skills, experience, and physical work location.  



SI Engineering places a high value on employee wellness and wellbeing, which is reflected in our competitive benefits package:

  


* 17 PTO Days per year, with an additional PTO for every year after five years, up to a maximum of 35 PTO Days.
* 10 Paid Holidays per year
* 100% 401K Matching, up to 5% of employee income
* A choice of two comprehensive health insurance plans
* Dental and Vision Insurance

SI Engineering, P.C. is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and career advancement without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We ensure nondiscrimination in all programs and activities in accordance with Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964. We are committed to creating a diverse, productive and healthful work environment.

Under the general supervision of the Associate/Assistant Director of Nursing, plans, implements, directs, supervises, and evaluates the delivery of age-appropriate nursing care to assigned patients, in accordance with established policies, procedures, and regulatory agency standards, and in a manner that embraces safety, quality, and efficiency.

All Clinical Units

* Participates in new recruitment interview as well as in mentoring and coaching of new staff and students

Champions Sports Center is the fastest growing sports center and offering Karate, Martial Arts, and Dodgeball for children and adults in the heart of Brooklyn, NY. We are the Home of World Champions winning World Karate and Dodgeball Championships in 2004 and 2018. We are family-oriented with 95-98% of the students being children ages 4 to 17 years old. Champions Sports Center provides an environment that reflects, respects and celebrates our differences and embraces the richness of our diversity.

**Are You Our Next Team Member?**

Do you genuinely care about connecting with others and being part of our great family/team? - Competitive hourly wage plus performance-based annual bonuses (between $1,000 to $1,500) upon year completion.

- Complying with all staff policies in accordance with our Center's Amenity Management.

**Ideal Candidate Attributes:**

- Positive personality with a commitment to punctuality, honesty, and reliability.

- Presentable and welcoming demeanor.

- Ability to multitask and prioritize in a high-paced setting.

- Well-organized, detail-oriented, with strong foresight.

title: Financial Counselor hybrid
description:
Enjoy what you do while contributing to a company that makes a difference in people’s lives. US fertility one of the premier fertility centers in the United States, continually seeks experienced, compassionate, and dynamic team players who are committed to delivering exceptional patient care to join our growing practice. The work we do building families offers stimulation, challenge, and personal reward.

If you're a Financial Counselor looking for a new opportunity to work in a fast-paced, professional environment where your talent contributes to changing people’s lives, then we want to talk to you. This position requires collaborating with physicians, other medical providers, and patients by providing expert care and service for fertility treatments.

We have an immediate opening for a **full-time Financial Counselor** to work for our **NY office.** The schedule is **Monday through Friday 9-5 or 10-6**

How You'll Contribute:

We always do whatever it takes, even if it isn’t specifically our “job.” In general, the Financial Counselor is responsible for:

Consult with patients regarding their benefits, coverage and financial options

Perform aspects of benefit verification and prior authorization

Provide ongoing financial education and assistance to our patients throughout the continuum of their care, as an educator, advocate, and liaison

Maintain patient accounts by obtaining, recording, and updating personal financial and insurance information

**Skills & Qualifications**

The skills and education we need are:

Minimum 2 to 4 years of medical business office experience, with working knowledge of healthcare billing and collections, insurance/benefits, and patient interaction

Must have experience reading and understanding payer remittance advice. Includes the ability to differentiate between allowed charges, contractual adjustments, line item denials/reasons, patient responsibility (co-pay, co-insurance, and deductibles), etc.

Bachelor's Degree preferred

Experience working in an OB/GYN office is a plus

Excellent interpersonal skills required to communicate with departments, employees, physicians, managers, patients, and insurance companies

Strong oral and written communication skills, independent worker, detailed-oriented, computer savvy

Proficient with Microsoft programs, specifically Outlook, Microsoft Word and Excel

High level of customer service essential

More important than the best skills, however, is the right person. Employees who embrace our mission, vision, and core values are highly successful.

At US Fertility, we promote and develop individual strengths in order to help staff grow personally and professionally. Our core values - Empathy, Patient Focus, Integrity, Commitment, and Compassion (EPICC) – guide us daily to work hard and enjoy what we do. We’re committed to growing our practice and are always looking to promote from within. This is an ideal time to join our team!

What We Offer: Full Benefits Package

Compensation: $45,000

How To Get Started:

To have your resume reviewed by someone on our Talent Acquisition team, click on the “Apply” button. Or if you happen to know of someone who might be interested in this position, please feel free to share the job description by clicking on an option under “Share This Job” at the top of the screen.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $21.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* Do you have 1 year of patient financial educating ?

title: Sales-Outside Representative
description:
Celtic Building Supplies, a business servicing construction companies, architects, contractors, engineers, and homebuilders in the tri-state area for over 20 years with all their building material, safety, and project needs, is seeking to hire an ***Outside Sales Representative (OSR)***.

At Celtic we are dedicated to providing **excellent service to our customers and to helping our staff make their career what they want it to be**.

***Family owned and operated, great culture, great benefits, and lots of room for growth! 60% of our employees have been with the company for 5 years or more.***

As an ***Outside Sales Rep*** you will be responsible for increasing sales and building relationships with customers in order to grow the footprint of the business and increase sales month over month. This includes generating business from prospective customers, making cold calls, sourcing customers through jobsite visits throughout the **tri-state area (NY, NJ and CT)**, and servicing business for existing customers in concert with the Inside Sales Rep. This is a ***full-time, salaried position with uncapped commission and ongoing bonuses.*** The starting salary range for this position is $45,000 - $65,000 per year.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* **85%-90% of the time will be focusing on generating business from prospective customers**
* 10%-15% of the time will focus on servicing existing customers in concert with the Inside Sales Rep (ISR)
* Network and develop relationships with developers, project managers, purchasers, and industry decision makers
* Actively participate in meetings, trade shows, and other industry events as needed
* Obtain continuous product knowledge
* Achieve all sales goals and metrics

**Required Skills and Competencies:**

* **Exceptional customer service is a must!**
* 3-5 years of aggressive inside or outside sales experience
* 1-3 years of Building Materials/ Building Supply or relevant experience preferred
* Knowledge of contractors, vendors, and competitors in the tristate area
* Handle high volume phone and email communication
* Basic knowledge of CRM software or previous experience with, and the use of organizational tools to manage book of business
* High-level technical skills: Microsoft Outlook, Mail, Calendar, Word and Excel
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Organized with an extraordinary attention to detail
* Dependable, reliable, and trustworthy
* Energetic, outgoing, and patient
* Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
* Ability to prioritize tasks, recognize the high sense of urgency, and to meet all deadlines
* Ability to professionally communicate, in English, across various departments with all levels of employees both verbally and in writing
* Ability to act independently and make decisions autonomously in accordance with Company Policy and Procedure

**Reports To:**

* Outside & Inside Sales Supervisor

**Why Build With Celtic?**  
**Responsive and Reliable**  
Celtic Building Supplies has over 20 years of frontline experience delivering quality building materials to every corner of NYC and the tri-state area. Whether you’re an architect, contractor, engineer, homebuilder or just passionate about DIY a warm welcome awaits you at The Celtic Store – A place where personal service, trust, and product expertise comes as standard. We sell everything for commercial and residential construction.

***Customer Service Is Essential To Our Success!***  
We perpetually strive to provide our customers with a combination of value added services coupled with superior products at competitive prices. Every member of our team is empowered to maximize the customer’s service experience on every transaction.***That is the Celtic Service Guarantee.***  
***When Service Matters, Build With Celtic!***

title: Human Services Provider II (Bilingual Spanish)
description:
**General Statement of Duties**
-------------------------------


Assesses client needs and recommends appropriate referrals for community services and treatment in order to provide support to individuals and families.  

  

Reports to the Director of Case Management or the Director of the Human Services Programs.


**Qualifications**
------------------


**Education and Experience:**  

Master’s degree in Behavioral Health from an accredited college or university, plus three (3) years of case management or behavioral health experience.  

  

**Licenses and Certifications:**  

Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW) or Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC) in the State of Connecticut within six months of employment.  

  

**Qualifications:**  

Demonstrated knowledge of therapeutic counseling and casework principles and practices.  

  

Demonstrated knowledge of Federal and State benefit and entitlement programs, as well as community resources available to individuals and families.  

  

Demonstrated ability to make client need assessments and formulate appropriate, effective, treatment plans.  

  

Proven ability to work independently and exercise sound judgment.  

  

Proven ability to communicate effectively in writing and orally in both English and Spanish.  

  

Demonstrated proficiency in the use of a personal computer and related software programs.  

  

Proven ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with clients, families, staff, agencies, and the public.  

  

Valid driver’s license.

 **Examination: 100% Training & Experience Assessment**

***The examination to determine a candidate's eligibility for the position will be a Training and Experience Assessment. This type of examination requires that you completely fill out the application, adding pages for additional relevant information where needed, and attaching any documentation of certificates, degrees, other significant documents, etc. A candidate's eligibility to be interviewed will be based solely on material submitted at the time of application. Once the Eligibility List is prepared no further information may be submitted and no adjustments will be made.***

  


**Job Description**
-------------------


**Department**: Human Services**Bargaining Status**: LIUNA**Salary Range**: L- E**Job Code**: 5953**Last Amended**: May 2024**FLSA Status**: Exempt  

**Duties and Responsibilities:**  

Conducts client intake interviews and assesses client needs in the areas of health, employment, finances, living facilities, legal rights, and family/social relations.  

  

Develops treatment and action plans, as well as treatment goals and outcome monitoring indicators.  

  

Provides counseling services and implements appropriate interventions for routine and crisis situations.  

  

Coordinates with clients, families, and outside agencies to determine eligibility for benefits and programs and assists the client with enrollment in State, Federal, Local, and private benefits programs and entitlements.  

  

Supervises staff as assigned.  

  

Serves as an advocate for clients in criminal, civil, housing, State, Federal, and other court proceedings.  

  

Consults with community groups to determine appropriate referrals and to build community resources.  

  

Utilizes the data management system to prepare and maintain case notes, assessments, and service plans.  

  

Conducts home visits or agency visits.  

  

Serves on community boards and committees as needed.  

  

Performs occasional evening work to meet client and program needs.  

  

Communicates in English and/or Spanish as necessary.  

  

Supports the Town's policies and philosophies.  

  

Performs other related work as required.
**Supplemental Information**
----------------------------


**All positions may be subject to an interview process. The Town reserves the right to limit the number of qualified candidates who will be invited to participate in the examination, or any part thereof.**  

  

**All outside candidates will be required to undertake and successfully pass a pre-employment medical examination, which includes a substance abuse test that includes testing for THC (the psychoactive ingredient in marijuana), given at the Town's expense prior to employment if conditionally offered a part time, full time or safety sensitive position.**  

  

**The Town of Greenwich has implemented a policy of background investigations all full and part time positions prior to hiring as part of the reference checking procedures for outside candidates. The investigation will only be conducted as the last step prior to an offer. Refusal to sign the release form will terminate the candidate's further consideration.**

title: Paint Prep Technician
description:
V&J Auto Body is a leading provider of exceptional auto body repair services, known for our cutting-edge technology, top-of-the-line equipment, and commitment to customer satisfaction. With over 40 years of success in the industry, we are proud to be a family-owned and operated business, serving Lindenhurst, New York, and the surrounding areas. Our mission is to provide our customers with transparent and high-quality auto body repairs, all while maintaining a safe and welcoming environment for our employees and clients.

As a Paint Prep Technician at V&J Auto Body, you will have the opportunity to join a team of passionate and skilled professionals who are dedicated to delivering exceptional results.

If you are a motivated and skilled Paint Prep Technician who takes pride in delivering exceptional work, we invite you to join our team at V&J Auto Body. In addition to competitive compensation, we offer a positive work environment, opportunities for growth, and a chance to be part of a reputable and thriving automotive repair business.

**Responsibilities**

The Paint Prep Technician is a critical role at V&J Auto Body and is responsible for surface preparation operations prior to priming/painting.

**Responsibilities include:** 

* Sand and smooth vehicle surfaces to ensure proper paint adhesion
* Clean and degrease surfaces to remove contaminants and prepare them for painting
* Mask off areas that should not be painted using tape and protective coverings to ensure clean paint lines
* Follow industry and manufacturer procedures diligently by adhering to the provided work order for each listed operation
* Utilize provided technology and software to update vehicle status and document procedures executed
* Utilize industry-standard tools and equipment to complete paint prep work efficiently and to high-quality standards
* Work collaboratively with other team members, including body technicians, painters and detailers, to ensure a seamless repair process from start to finish
* Adhere to company policies and procedures, as well as relevant safety guidelines, to ensure a safe working environment
* Maintain a clean and organized work area, ensuring the safety and cleanliness of the shop at all times
* Stay up-to-date with the latest paint-prepping techniques and industry advancements through continuous learning and professional development
* Other duties as assigned, including but not limited to: shop maintenance, shop projects, company initiatives, etc

**Requirements:**

* 18 years or older
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Proven experience as a paint prep technician, 3+ years experience preferred
* Excellent knowledge of paint prep techniques and industry best practices
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to assess and diagnose vehicle issues appropriately
* Detail-oriented mindset with a commitment to delivering high-quality workmanship
* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact with team members
* Professional attitude and the ability to work well in a team-oriented environment
* Ability to lift items up to 50lbs.

**Benefits**

* Health insurance
* Complimentary accident insurance
* PTO
* Paid holidays
* Competitive retirement plan options
* Industry training opportunities
* Fully climate-controlled work environment

title: Biz Quiz Intern
description:
**About Us**



The FT has an uncompromising mission: delivering independent, quality information, news and services to individuals and companies around the globe. It's the cornerstone of our reputation and the heart of our ambitions for the future. But for our people, the FT offers so much more than what we do. FT people come from all kinds of backgrounds and work across a huge range of disciplines and locations, and find an empowering, warm and welcoming culture that values curiosity and rewards inquisitive, ambitious thinking. Those who are willing to unite around our mission and live our values will find plenty to challenge, inspire and interest them. Like the audiences we serve, no two FT people are the same; but together we help our audience be better informed and understand the world around them. It's a job that's never mattered more, and a career that can take you anywhere you want to go.

  


**Our commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace**



At the FT, we give all employees a voice so that diverse perspectives are heard and valued. We believe that a supportive workplace is one where employees feel they can be themselves at work. We'll continue to remove barriers for all, and in particular barriers facing employees from underrepresented groups.

  


**The Role / Position Overview**



As the Biz Quiz Question Writer, you will play a pivotal role in creating high-quality questions for the second annual Biz Quiz competition, co-hosted by the University of California, Davis Graduate School of Management and the Financial Times. Your well-crafted questions will challenge the participants' knowledge of FT.com news and analysis, taken from content published during the competition reading period (October 1 - November 10). This role offers a unique opportunity to enhance your writing skills, engage extensively with FT.com content, and contribute to the quiz competition.

  


**Key Responsibilities**


* **Content Consumption**: Read FT.com content that has been selected for Biz Quiz and published during the reading period.
* **Question Development**: Collaborate with FT Professional and members of Editorial to create balanced, accurate, and engaging questions suitable for each stage of the competition.
* **Subject Variety**: Generate questions that cover the full range of subjects discussed on FT.com during the reading period.
* **Quality Assurance**: Review and edit questions for accuracy and clarity, and maintain a reference document with the questions, answers, and link to the source article.
* **Feedback Incorporation**: Integrate feedback from team members during weekly check-ins and modify questions accordingly to improve quality.
* **Adherence to Deadlines**: Meet assigned deadlines for question submissions to ensure smooth preparation for the competition.
* **Communication**: Collaborate effectively with team members to maintain clear communication channels and contribute to the overall success of Biz Quiz.

  


**Required Skills / Experience**


* **Education**: Enrolled in or recently graduated from a graduate degree program (e.g., MBA, MS in Finance or related).
* **Writing Skills**: Excellent written communication skills with the ability to craft clear and concise questions.
* **Attention to Detail**: Meticulous attention to detail to ensure the accuracy and quality of questions and the corresponding reference document.
* **Time Management**: Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
* **Team Player**: A collaborative attitude with the ability to work well within a team environment.
* **Tech-Savvy**: Comfortable with basic digital tools and online collaboration platforms.
* Preferred: Experience in the Finance industry, or a Finance specialized degree.

  


**Compensation**

  



This is a part-time, paid, eight-week internship, ideally starting the week of September 30. Expected time commitment is 25 hours per week at a rate of $25 per hour.

  


**Further Information**



The FT is committed to providing an inclusive working environment for all. We are an equal opportunities employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best talent regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We also promote flexible working and will consider specific requests around flexibility for all roles where it can be accommodated. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments as part of the application process or to enable you to attend an interview. If you would like to discuss your requirements, or have any questions, please contact a member of our HR team who will be happy to help.

title: 4476 - Python Developer
description:
Job Description:

Client seeking a highly skilled Python Developer with a strong background in data management and a basic understanding of trading mechanics for Equities products. This role is crucial for developing and maintaining systems that handle critical financial data, including positions and P&L (Profit & Loss) data flows. The ideal candidate will be proficient in Python, SQL, ETL processes, and API integration, and will possess a solid foundation in financial trading concepts.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain Python-based applications to support trading operations, including data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
* Design and implement SQL queries to handle large datasets related to trading positions and P&L.
* Integrate APIs to ensure seamless data flow between trading systems and other applications.
* Collaborate with trading teams to understand and enhance data flows related to Equities products.
* Ensure accuracy and timeliness of data related to positions and P&L, supporting business decisions and compliance requirements.

title: CaseWorker/Seniors Program Facilitator
description:
**Job Title: CaseWorker/Seniors Program Facilitator**

Reports to: Case Manager, New York Community Center

Location: Queens, NY

Women for Afghan Women (WAW) is a grassroots, civil society organization dedicated to securing and protecting the rights of disenfranchised Afghan women and girls in Afghanistan and New York, particularly their rights to develop their individual potential, to self-determination, and to be represented in all areas of life. WAW advocates for women’s rights and challenges the norms that underpin gender-based violence wherever opportunities arise to influence attitudes and bring about change.

**Position Summary**

The CaseWorker/Seniors Program Facilitator is a full-time position at WAW’s New York Community Center (NYCC) and reports directly to the Program Director. The CaseWorker/Seniors Program Facilitator is responsible for working on various client’s cases in a timely manner, supporting the Staff Attorney alongside the case and Education team . The CaseWorker/Seniors Program Facilitator will provide services as needed, always using a strength-based approach. The caseworker will work with external organizations and agencies to maximize support for WAW’s clients and Educational Program

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist in implementing service plans determined by goals of clients, including reviewing service plans, identifying progress, and revising the plan as needed.
* Conduct safety assessment and safety planning with domestic violence survivors and assist them in obtaining safe shelter while their case is being processed.
* Accompany or arrange for clients who need support to other agencies, facilities, and appointments.
* Seek opportunities to partner and collaborate with organizations in the NYC area to maximize the resources of the NYCC.
* Assess and implement cases for clients required to appear at fair hearings.
* Refer clients to other organizations for additional services, (e.g. family legal services, shelters).
* Advise clients about the services they are entitled to.
* Translate on behalf of clients.
* Assist the legal team filling out USCIS forms for clients.
* Ensure all client information is entered into WAW’s database in a timely manner.
* Ensure the hard copy of clients’ case files are updated and securely stored.
* Facilitate and translate in-person and remotely for programs and workshops, as needed.
* Draft profiles of WAW clients, as needed.

**Support education programs, in collaboration with the Education Coordinator:**

* Facilitate Youth and Seniors Programs, as needed, delivering program curriculaim and engaging, respectful, and welcoming manner.
* Collaborate with Education Coordinator in the development of new educational programs.
* Conduct outreach for pre- and post-program surveys and registration.
* Maintain accurate records, including attendance and program notes.
* Participate in regular meetings with partner educational organizations.
* Provide monthly written progress and other reports as required.
* Plan needs and request program supplies in a timely manner.

**Organizational Responsibilities**

* Serve as a spokesperson on behalf of WAW at various programs, meetings, and functions when approved by the US Country Director and/or Executive Director.
* Translate for participants at monthly Women’s Circle sessions and other programs as needed.
* Help with the community outreach, events, administrative tasks, special projects, and assignments, as needed.
* Stay informed and updated about WAW’s programs in Afghanistan.

**Compensation**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000-55,000 annually, depending on experience

Benefits: 403(b) plan; Dental insurance; Health insurance; Life insurance; Paid time off

Schedule: Monday-Friday, 9 am – 5 pm

**Ability to commute/relocate**

This position is located in Queens, NY. Candidates must reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work. (Required)

**To apply, submit your cover letter and resume via email. Please type CaseWorker/Seniors Program Facilitator, NY – [your last name] in the subject line and apply at your earliest convenience as we are looking to hire as soon as possible. No phone calls please.**

*Women for Afghan Women is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value a diverse workforce and inclusive workplace. We consider all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, disability, socioeconomic status, marital or veteran status, pregnancy status or sexual orientation.*

Pay: $50,000.00 - $52,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Associate (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Computational Science Manager - Mitra Lab
description:
**Position Description**

The Brain Architecture Project (led by Dr. Partha Mitra) is looking to hire an ambitious computationally skilled scientist passionate about mapping and understanding the principles of brain-wide neural networks across vertebrate species including Mouse, Marmoset and Human. The Brain Architecture project is a vertically integrated effort spanning experiment, computation and theory. To date, the project has collected a large corpus (>6 petabytes) of light-microscopic whole-brain data sets for mapping mesoscale projections as well as single neuronal morphology across the species. The data are being computationally analyzed to extract the principles of brain circuit architecture and being shared online with the scientific community through a web portal.

The Computational Science Manager will have a leadership role in the team working on the computational/analytical pipeline for the project data, spanning a computational chain that proceeds from gigapixel light microscopic data through feature extraction and atlas mapping, to summarization and interpretation in neurobiologically meaningful terms, to visualization/annotation of the results on the web portal, and to scientific publications. Key responsibilities will include the necessary project management, project reporting and leading the publication efforts, in addition to computational responsibilities including working hands-on with the project databases and analytical pipelines to enable the project outputs including publications.

The ideal candidate for the Computational Science Manager position will be proficient with at least one of and familiar with all of: Matlab, Python, MySQL/SQL, Javascript, Bash/Shell and Terminal, and C/C++. The ideal candidate will also have a track record of publication success and prior experience in contributing to the writing and composition of grant and fellowship funding applications. Interested applicants are encouraged to apply via the online CSHL application system.

**Position Responsibilities**

* Project Management of the computational pipeline and personnel for the Brain Architecture Project
* Management of lab databases and metadata
* Coordination with the experimental lab at the Brain Architecture Project
* Coordination and close communication with collaborating labs at and external to CSHL
* Preparing of funded award progress reports, including text and figure composition
* Grant and fellowship application assembly, including writing text, composing figures, and tracking, organizing, and compiling various application components
* Manuscript assembly, including writing text and composing figures

**Position Requirements**

EDUCATION:

* MS in Computer science, Neuroscience, Physics, or a related field. PhD preferred.

EXPERIENCE:

* 6+ years of prior experience (including graduate degree time) in a scientific or industrial research setting with a strong computational/data analytic component relevant to project data.
* Prior experience with manuscript writing, including a proven track record of publication success
* Prior experience with microscopic image processing and analysis a plus
* Prior experience with grant or fellowship writing a plus
* Prior experience managing a research team or laboratory a plus
* Prior experience with querying, filling, or managing databases a plus
* Prior experience with website design, management, or development a plus

SKILLS:

* Proficiency in at least one of and familiarity with all of: Matlab, Python (including Matplotlib, PyTorch, and Numpy packages), MySQL/SQL, Javascript (especially Angular and Node.js frameworks), HTML, Terminal, Bash/Shell, C/C++
* Proficient with MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
* Familiarity with Raster (Inkscape, GIMP, Adobe Photoshop) and Vector (Illustrator) based graphics editing software
* Strong written and verbal communication skills, including manuscript writing experience
* Strong project, task, and time management skills, including strong organizational skills

**Supplemental Information**

**How to Apply:**  
We encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Please submit an online application here: Computational Science Manager- Mitra Lab Position 1283. We look forward to reviewing your application.

**Environment**  
Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory is a world-renowned biomedical research institution in New York. It has shaped contemporary biomedical research and is the home of eight Nobel Prize laureates. Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory provides a highly dynamic and interactive research environment and also a unique opportunity of timely exposure to advances in various biomedical research fields and of interaction with a broad range of researchers from all over the world through its renowned Meetings and Courses program. We believe that science is for everyone. We have had researchers with a variety of backgrounds and believe in the importance of diversity, equity, and inclusion.

**Compensation and Benefits**  
Our employees are compensated in many ways for their contributions to our mission, including competitive pay, exceptional health benefits, retirement plans, time off, and a range of recognition and wellness programs. Visit our CSHL Benefits sites to learn more. The salary range for this role is$78,000-$90,000. The salary range and/or hourly rate listed is a good faith determination of potential base compensation that may be offered to a successful applicant for this position at the time of this job advertisement and may be modified in the future. When determining a base salary and/or rate, several factors may be considered as applicable (e.g., years of relevant experience, education, credentials, and internal equity).

CSHL is an EO/AA Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status. VEVRAA Federal Contractor

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $78,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Cold Spring Harbor, NY 11724: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Employment Training Specialist
description:
**Daily Pay: Work today, get paid today!!!**

**Job Summary:**

Under direction of the Program Supervisor, Employment Training Specialists are responsible for assisting a caseload of individuals with intellectual and developmental disabilities (I/DD) establish and pursue their employment goals including obtaining and maintaining successful employment. ETSs provide job coaching, on-the-job and vocational training and assist in the improvement of communication and socialization skills through regular visits or direct supervision of people we support at their workplaces across assigned region(s), virtual and one-on-one meetings. Arranges, schedules and travels to workplace visits and coordinates required meetings with Care Managers and other professional supports and accurately documents services in a timely manner.

* This position serves in the capacity as a Direct Support Professional 2.
* Serving as the liaison between Management and the person you are supporting
* Advocating on behalf of the employee
* Guiding and modeling on-the-job responsibilities to ensure the persons full comprehension of employment tasks

**Location:** Tarrytown: **This position requires commuting throughout Westchester**

**Hours:** Monday - Friday 8am-4pm

**Key/Essential Functions & Responsibilities**

Ensures health, wellness and safety by providing appropriate supervision of the people we support and by managing crisis situations while adhering to policies, procedures and regulations, meeting and demonstrating OPWDD Core Competencies.

* Ensures person-centered plans are implemented and assists with a variety of tasks for people we support, as appropriate/authorized, including:
* Participating in development of staff action plans
* Developing job placement
* Supporting person-centered advocacy with the individual
* Facilitating ethical decision making
* Supports people with I/DD to realize, set and meet their employment goals, assisting them in overcoming their personal barriers and engages in respectful communications/conversations through person-first language to help them understand their goals and ambitions.
* Responsible for caseload of individuals, arranging and scheduling workplace visits, virtual and one-on-one meetings and coordinating required meetings and liaising with Care Managers and other professional supports.
* Assists individuals in maximizing their strengths, interests, and abilities, upholding their personal rights, providing emotional support, assisting in communication, socialization and self-expression and building positive relationships by interacting with others at their worksites in innovative and creative ways.
* Works with unemployed individuals, providing pre-employment counseling to explore career interests and support job development activities and facilitating training groups where professional skills and behaviors are taught and developed to assist people we support in obtaining and maintaining employment in the community.
* Directly supervises and provides on-site job and job skills training, coaching and support at job sites for people we support and in accordance with each person’s employment goals, utilizing support skills for people with moderate to complex levels of need.
* Regularly travels across assigned region to visit employed individuals at their workplaces, speaking with managers to obtain feedback on performance and addressing any issues or concerns that may arise; escalates issues and concerns to an administrator for support, as needed.
* Serves as a member of a highly effective team (teamwork w/in the circle of support), providing feedback and communicating programmatic needs to members of team and maintaining a solution-oriented approach during conflicts.
* Maintains a therapeutic environment through a variety of methods: Personal Outcome Measures, Person Centered Thinking, Informed Decision Making.
* Models professionalism, punctuality, ownership and accountability to the people we support and effectively manages time and responsibilities, ensuring all individuals/cases are appropriately supported and monitored
* Facilitates learning and training in fire safety for PWS, including emergency and evacuation drills at assigned worksite(s).
* Develops and maintains understanding of specialized clinical knowledge for person specific needs (supporting adults, challenging behaviors, autism spectrum disorders, complex medical needs) as they relate to obtaining and maintaining employment.
* Reviews and completes all other required paperwork and documentation to ensure compliance and/or billing, as applicable, completely and accurately and within appropriate timeframes (e.g., notifications, logging, incident reports, update files, maintenance requests, phone calls, progress notes and services).
* Complies with all Federal, State, Local and other relevant regulatory agency requirements, including the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).
* May perform direct support professional tasks, including providing personal care and assisting in activities of daily living (ADLs) in other settings outside of employment if appropriately trained and authorized, as directed and/or outside of employment schedule (e.g. residential, day services, community habilitation, etc.).
* Performs all other duties as assigned.

**Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**

* Interpersonal and problem-solving skills
* Willing to take initiative

**Benefits Include:**

* Daily Pay!! Work today, get paid today!!
* Retirement Plan with matching contributions
* Generous paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Discounts on wireless service, gym membership, & more!!!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

* Developmental disabilities experience: 1 year (Preferred)

title: Account Executive
description:
**Summary**

This position is a collaborative effort between a high-profile fashion house and a 3PL to ensure a flawless supply chain to its clients. In addition to working with the management of said fashion house and their service providers, the employee will also manage the logistical operations to fulfill the store orders; manage the inventory levels; handle returns, as well as manage the departmental team and meet the deadlines. Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

**Key Responsibilities**

* Oversee daily workload of assigned department team members to ensure they work productively and meet deadlines and company standards.
* Responsible for the day-to-day activities and guidance of their Team Members.
* Account Executives set targets, implement guidelines, and assist with any issues the Team Member may have.
* Ensure Team Members follow company policies and procedures.
* Administer Corrective Counseling documents to Team Members when there are violations of the company policy as listed in the company handbook. Monitor and approve Team Member's work hours, PTO and Sick time on Paycom to ensure payroll compliance and accuracy.
* Discover training needs and work with Training and Development Manager to provide coaching and feedback.
* Conduct performance reviews on an annual basis.
* Respond to customer communications and concerns regarding projects and daily workload.
* Manage activities throughout the order fulfillment and transportation cycle to make sure established deadlines given by the client are met.
* Maintaining constant communication with our client’s point person.
* Coordinate with team to meet delivery goals to our client’s wholesale vendors.
* Processes and follows up on client requests such as: tracking deliveries and monitoring inventory.
* Address any Customer Service issues that our clients may have.
* Maintain accurate inventory levels and ensure accuracy of inventory reports.
* Ensure warehouse team’s efficiency as well as quality of work.

* Ensure EDI compliance standards are met by Team Members.

title: Sales Associate (Outside Sales)
description:
Celtic Building Supplies, a business servicing construction companies, architects, contractors, engineers, and homebuilders in the tri-state area for over 20 years with all their building material, safety, and project needs, is seeking to hire an ***Outside Sales Representative (OSR)***.

At Celtic we are dedicated to providing **excellent service to our customers and to helping our staff make their career what they want it to be**.

***Family owned and operated, great culture, great benefits, and lots of room for growth! 60% of our employees have been with the company for 5 years or more.***

As an ***Outside Sales Rep*** you will be responsible for increasing sales and building relationships with customers in order to grow the footprint of the business and increase sales month over month. This includes generating business from prospective customers, making cold calls, sourcing customers through jobsite visits throughout the **tri-state area (NY, NJ and CT)**, and servicing business for existing customers in concert with the Inside Sales Rep. This is a ***full-time, salaried position with uncapped commission and ongoing bonuses.*** The starting salary range for this position is $45,000 - $65,000 per year.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* **85%-90% of the time will be focusing on generating business from prospective customers**
* 10%-15% of the time will focus on servicing existing customers in concert with the Inside Sales Rep (ISR)
* Network and develop relationships with developers, project managers, purchasers, and industry decision makers
* Actively participate in meetings, trade shows, and other industry events as needed
* Obtain continuous product knowledge
* Achieve all sales goals and metrics

**Required Skills and Competencies:**

* **Exceptional customer service is a must!**
* 3-5 years of aggressive inside or outside sales experience
* 1-3 years of Building Materials/ Building Supply or relevant experience preferred
* Knowledge of contractors, vendors, and competitors in the tristate area
* Handle high volume phone and email communication
* Basic knowledge of CRM software or previous experience with, and the use of organizational tools to manage book of business
* High-level technical skills: Microsoft Outlook, Mail, Calendar, Word and Excel
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Organized with an extraordinary attention to detail
* Dependable, reliable, and trustworthy
* Energetic, outgoing, and patient
* Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
* Ability to prioritize tasks, recognize the high sense of urgency, and to meet all deadlines
* Ability to professionally communicate, in English, across various departments with all levels of employees both verbally and in writing
* Ability to act independently and make decisions autonomously in accordance with Company Policy and Procedure

**Reports To:**

* Outside & Inside Sales Supervisor

**Why Build With Celtic?**  
**Responsive and Reliable**  
Celtic Building Supplies has over 20 years of frontline experience delivering quality building materials to every corner of NYC and the tri-state area. Whether you’re an architect, contractor, engineer, homebuilder or just passionate about DIY a warm welcome awaits you at The Celtic Store – A place where personal service, trust, and product expertise comes as standard. We sell everything for commercial and residential construction.

***Customer Service Is Essential To Our Success!***  
We perpetually strive to provide our customers with a combination of value added services coupled with superior products at competitive prices. Every member of our team is empowered to maximize the customer’s service experience on every transaction.***That is the Celtic Service Guarantee.***  
***When Service Matters, Build With Celtic!***

Job Type: Full-time

title: Veterinary Technician
description:
**\\*\\*\\* SIGN ON BONUS \\*\\*\\***


**Position Overview:**



The Veterinary Technician supports hospital operations by providing dedicated quality veterinary care and exceptional service to our patients and clients. Responsibilities include providing patient care by determining animal requirements, conducting examinations and diagnostic procedures, assisting during surgery and operations, providing nursing care, assisting with feeding and caring for patients, maintaining medical supplies and equipment, overseeing triage and discharging patients, and maintaining patient medical records.


**Essential Position Functions:**


* Determine animal requirements by conducting examinations and interviews, reviewing care plans and records, completing laboratory tests and studies, and diagnostic imaging.
* Care for patients by taking vital signs, collecting samples, administering medications, drugs, and vaccines, and bandaging and wrapping wounds.
* Support patient examinations and operations by assembling required supplies and instruments, securing and bringing patients to examination rooms, and restraining patients; aids as directed by the veterinarian.
* Provide excellent pet care by applying full knowledge of anatomy, physiology, disease processes, pharmacology, specialized equipment usage, and specialized drug administration.
* Obtain and verify medications.
* Ensure that patients have food and water, clean patients' rooms, cages, and equipment; observe patients for clinical signs of disease.
* As directed, fill prescriptions and administer medications, including proper documentation, logging, and security of controlled drugs.
* Maintain a safe, secure, healthy, and humane environment by sterilizing and wrapping instruments, sanitizing and disinfecting holding and operating areas, storing sterile supplies, verifying shelf life, following standards and procedures, and in compliance with applicable legal regulations.
* Maintain medical records by documenting patients' conditions, reactions, and changes; update the database in an accurate and timely manner.
* Communicate with the pet owner about the status of the patient, as directed by the veterinarian.
* Maintain equipment by following operating instructions, troubleshooting breakdowns, maintaining equipment supplies, performing preventive maintenance, and calling for repairs.
* Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities and reading professional journals.
* Release pets to their owners as directed; ensure that every animal released is clean and properly groomed before their release.
* Understand and carry out oral and written directions.
* Perform other duties as assigned by Manager or practice.


**Competencies:**


* Care and Compassion: Displays a desire to build rapport, provide personal assistance, and emotional support.
* Team Orientation: Works cooperatively with the team to address tasks and accomplish goals.
* Dependability: Demonstrates responsibility in completing tasks and accomplishing goals.
* Initiative: Proactively looks for the opportunity to address and follow through on work activities.
* Flexibility and Multi-Tasking: Adapts quickly to changing demands and manages multiple priorities effectively.
* Communication: Uses effective and appropriate methods of interacting with others.
* Customer Services: Displays a desire to provide outstanding service and exceed customer expectations.
* Organization and Attention to Detail: Monitors and reviews information thoroughly and maintains an organized system for all documents.
* Adherence to Rules and Instructions: Consistently follows standard procedures.


**Qualifications:**


* High school diploma or GED.
* Two or more years of experience with veterinary appointments, surgeries, and nursing care for hospitalized and critical patients.
* Licensed Veterinary Technician (LVT)
* May consider an equivalent combination of education, certification, training, and/or experience.


**Position Knowledge and Skill Requirements:**


* Knowledge of the preparation, monitoring, and recovery of pets receiving surgery, as well as basic pet nursing.
* Ability to demonstrate and follow correct procedures in catheter placement, phlebotomy, emergency medicine, and digital radiology.
* Understand and limit the potential exposure to bites, scratches, and potential injuries.
* Able to restrain patients according to standard procedures.
* Fill prescriptions and monitor sedation procedures as directed by the veterinarian.
* Ability to work with or around sick animals, potentially hazardous materials, cleaning chemicals, gas anesthetics, zoonotic diseases, and unpleasant odors.
* Display confidence and reassurance when dealing with pets experiencing severe stress, illness, or pain.
* Communicate and approach job duties in a professional and mature manner.
* This is a strenuous job that requires a lot of lifting, cleaning, and constant motion.
* Depending on the functional area of assignment, tasks may involve extended periods of time at a keyboard or workstation and/or extended periods of time standing and/or walking.
* May include some climbing, balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, or crawling.
* Some tasks involve the periodic performance of moderately physically demanding work, usually involving lifting or carrying moderately heavy animals (up to 50 pounds).
* Answer phones and perform other duties as needed by the hospital.
* Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by Manager or practice.


**Additional Information:**



The list of essential functions and additional functions, as outlined in this job description, is intended to be representative of the tasks performed within this position. The omission of any job function does not preclude management from assigning duties not listed herein if such functions are a required assignment for the position.



PetVet Care Centers, Inc. is one of the nation's leading operators of veterinary hospitals for companion animals. The company operates over 450 hospitals across multiple states and employs over 11,000 people including over 800 veterinarians. Since its inception, PetVet has been structured around a model that is focused on developing a partnership between the hospitals and the company and providing the highest quality medicine and service.



PetVet is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, religion, citizenship, national origin/ancestry, physical/mental disabilities, military status or any other basis prohibited by law. EOE, M/F/D/V



PetVet respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal information. Please see our privacy notice for additional information about our data practices.

title: Receptionist
description:
The Receptionist supports and adds value to an efficient organization dedicated to quality care and exceptional service. You will perform a variety of clerical and customer service work in providing support to the hospital, and to clients during often high stress situations.



Westfield Animal Hospital is a very busy, multi doctor practice that offers plenty of opportunities for our employees to grow. We are looking for an energetic, enthusiastic, and quick learning individual to join our team!


**Tasks include:**


+ Coordinate the flow of pets and owners in the lobby; placates owners distressed by long waits, scheduling glitches, and other problems.

* Capable of answering multiple phone lines
* Identify potential emergencies in person, and over the phone, and schedule those appointments appropriately.
* Organize and process all payment plans, billing statements, and collections.
* Perform cashiering duties; process refunds, returns and credits as needed.
* Responds to inquiries about the range of services the practice provides and the species it treats; refer to appropriate department/staff member as needed.
* Input data to practice management software to check pets in; make simple postings to accounts; compile data for various reports.
* Receive and distribute incoming mail; and process outgoing mail.
* Coordinate and schedule appointments; provide clients with appointment reminders and any special instructions; call clients whose pets have overdue treatments.
* Respond to client emails; type and edit a variety of correspondence, and process faxes.
* Able to learn basic veterinary medicine terminology.
* Become familiar with retail products, medications, vaccinations, routine testing, and heartworm and flea preventatives and be able to confidently discuss with clients.
* Use Windows based computer systems, word processing, email, web search and other skills needed to effectively use software.


**Minimum Qualifications/Requirements:**


* High school diploma, GED or equivalent combination of education, and/or experience.
* Knowledge of clerical procedures such as alphabetizing files and records.
* Must be flexible with scheduling and able to work some weekends and holiday.
* Tasks may involve extended periods of time at a keyboard or workstation and/or extended periods of time standing and/or walking.
* Some moderately physically demanding work, involving lifting or carrying up to 50 pounds.

title: Sales Representative (Outside Sales)
description:
Celtic Building Supplies, a business servicing construction companies, architects, contractors, engineers, and homebuilders in the tri-state area for over 20 years with all their building material, safety, and project needs, is seeking to hire an ***Outside Sales Representative (OSR)***.

At Celtic we are dedicated to providing **excellent service to our customers and to helping our staff make their career what they want it to be**.

***Family owned and operated, great culture, great benefits, and lots of room for growth! 60% of our employees have been with the company for 5 years or more.***

As an ***Outside Sales Rep*** you will be responsible for increasing sales and building relationships with customers in order to grow the footprint of the business and increase sales month over month. This includes generating business from prospective customers, making cold calls, sourcing customers through jobsite visits throughout the **tri-state area (NY, NJ and CT)**, and servicing business for existing customers in concert with the Inside Sales Rep. This is a ***full-time, salaried position with uncapped commission and ongoing bonuses.*** The starting salary range for this position is $45,000 - $65,000 per year.

**Core Responsibilities:**

* **85%-90% of the time will be focusing on generating business from prospective customers**
* 10%-15% of the time will focus on servicing existing customers in concert with the Inside Sales Rep (ISR)
* Network and develop relationships with developers, project managers, purchasers, and industry decision makers
* Actively participate in meetings, trade shows, and other industry events as needed
* Obtain continuous product knowledge
* Achieve all sales goals and metrics

**Required Skills and Competencies:**

* **Exceptional customer service is a must!**
* 3-5 years of aggressive inside or outside sales experience
* 1-3 years of Building Materials/ Building Supply or relevant experience preferred
* Knowledge of contractors, vendors, and competitors in the tristate area
* Handle high volume phone and email communication
* Basic knowledge of CRM software or previous experience with, and the use of organizational tools to manage book of business
* High-level technical skills: Microsoft Outlook, Mail, Calendar, Word and Excel
* Strong problem-solving skills
* Organized with an extraordinary attention to detail
* Dependable, reliable, and trustworthy
* Energetic, outgoing, and patient
* Ability to work both independently and in a team environment
* Ability to prioritize tasks, recognize the high sense of urgency, and to meet all deadlines
* Ability to professionally communicate, in English, across various departments with all levels of employees both verbally and in writing
* Ability to act independently and make decisions autonomously in accordance with Company Policy and Procedure

**Reports To:**

* Outside & Inside Sales Supervisor

**Why Build With Celtic?**  
**Responsive and Reliable**  
Celtic Building Supplies has over 20 years of frontline experience delivering quality building materials to every corner of NYC and the tri-state area. Whether you’re an architect, contractor, engineer, homebuilder or just passionate about DIY a warm welcome awaits you at The Celtic Store – A place where personal service, trust, and product expertise comes as standard. We sell everything for commercial and residential construction.

***Customer Service Is Essential To Our Success!***  
We perpetually strive to provide our customers with a combination of value added services coupled with superior products at competitive prices. Every member of our team is empowered to maximize the customer’s service experience on every transaction.***That is the Celtic Service Guarantee.***  
***When Service Matters, Build With Celtic!***
