title: Principal Scientist, Primary Packaging - Parenteral MS&T
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Description**  

  

This position provides global technical stewardship of primary container closure systems for the BMS portfolio of commercial parenteral biologic and small molecule drug products. This position is accountable for the technical interface with product development to enable requirements definition, design and selection of robust primary container systems such as stoppers, vials, and seals for commercial biologic drug product. This individual has technical ownership of global primary packaging systems for parenteral drug product throughout the commercial product lifecycle at BMS. This includes global oversight of specifications for components, performance monitoring within supplier manufacturing processes, and test methods.
  

  

**Key responsibilities include*** Leads technical workstreams for lifecycle management of commercial products, including but not limited to: supplier management, risk analysis, component and technology improvements.
* Supports sites globally to resolve critical and complex quality events and manage complex change controls. Evaluates changes (component, product, process) post design transfer to assess risk/impact on manufacturing process, documentation and design control elements.
* Supports site investigations, lead center led investigations, and product complaint trends related to primary components. This includes forensic analysis of complaints, understanding usage, conducting Design of Experiments, and application of other engineering tools to determine root cause and ensure components and materials meet BMS performance and quality standards
* Develops and transfer primary container specifications and incoming test methods for late stage development and commercial parenteral products and collaborates with secondary packaging to ensure the primary container systems meet shipping and cold chain requirements.
* Participates in design reviews and provide SME input. Review supporting documentation, approving documents as part of tech transfer, and ensure those documents are suitable to minimize risk to commercial manufacturing, supply, and patients.
* Employs project management practices for developing project timelines, resources, monitoring progress and project status communication.
* Supports primary packaging related regulatory filings pre and post approval.
* Supports Manufacturing sites, Procurement, Global Quality and Compliance in supplier, customer, internal, and/or regulatory agency audits and provide technical leadership of supplier robustness, which includes assessments of component manufacturers' supply capability.
* Collaborates cross-functionally to promote awareness and ensure compliance to new regulatory policies, regulations, directives, and other issues related to primary packaging systems. Builds a strong relationship with the combination device organization, including the individuals that work on device primary packaging components.
* Actively participates in an internal and external network of experts, and industry forums, to keep the organization at the forefront of primary packaging technology and next generation option. Represents Bristol Myers Squibb at conferences to contribute innovation sharing.
* Collaborates with primary container development, device development, marketing, supply chain, global procurement, logistics, internal and external manufacturing sites, to successfully develop, tech transfer and launch packaged products
* Works with clinical and manufacturing sites to establish design requirements, and support new primary container closure systems selection in early development/clinical phase programs.

**Qualifications*** Bachelor degree with 7 years of relevant experience. Relevant Masters or Ph.D. degrees are preferred (but not required). Time spent in advanced degree program may be considered as equivalent experience.

**Key Skills and Experience*** Expert in Biologics/sterile/liquid drug product packaging systems design and/or manufacture.
* Experience with drug product parenteral visual inspection techniques, standards, and forensics with respect to primary container defects preferred.
* Deep scientific understanding of the materials science and technology behind the manufacture and design of primary container systems, with a particular emphasis on glass properties and related defects and elastomer properties and manufacturing processes.
* Demonstrated technical experience working with primary component suppliers for parenteral drug product, particularly with marketed products.
* Thorough knowledge of quality systems, Quality by Design, validation principles for product and manufacturing processes, engineering design and process control fundamentals including primary container analysis.
* Thorough understanding of regulations, familiarity of regulatory environment and industry trends for primary container design and manufacturing.
* Strong analytical, technical writing, interpersonal, and communication skills with ability to present internally/ externally to suppliers, sites, health authorities, and Sr. Management.
* Demonstrated ability to:
	+ influence areas not under direct control to achieve objectives
	+ work strategically, manage multiple programs and create a high performance work environment
	+ work in a matrix environment and effectively support internal & external manufacturers and suppliers
	+ build alignment with business partners and key stakeholders
	+ manage risk and make rapid decisions
* Working competency of statistical programs (i.e., Minitab, SAS, etc.)
* Certified Six Sigma Green/Black belt or equivalent preferred
* Product development experience and manufacturing experience a plus


If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn't perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.
  

  

**Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers**  

With a single vision as inspiring as Transforming patients' lives through science™ , every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.  

  

**On-site Protocol**  

  

BMS has a diverse occupancy structure that determines where an employee is required to conduct their work. This structure includes site-essential, site-by-design, field-based and remote-by-design jobs. The occupancy type that you are assigned is determined by the nature and responsibilities of your role:
  

  

Site-essential roles require 100% of shifts onsite at your assigned facility. Site-by-design roles may be eligible for a hybrid work model with at least 50% onsite at your assigned facility. For these roles, onsite presence is considered an essential job function and is critical to collaboration, innovation, productivity, and a positive Company culture. For field-based and remote-by-design roles the ability to physically travel to visit customers, patients or business partners and to attend meetings on behalf of BMS as directed is an essential job function.
  

  

BMS is dedicated to ensuring that people with disabilities can excel through a transparent recruitment process, reasonable workplace accommodations/adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Applicants can request a reasonable workplace accommodation/adjustment prior to accepting a job offer. If you require reasonable accommodations/adjustments in completing this application, or in any part of the recruitment process, direct your inquiries to adastaffingsupport@bms.com . Visit careers.bms.com/ eeo -accessibility to access our complete Equal Employment Opportunity statement.
  

  

BMS cares about your well-being and the well-being of our staff, customers, patients, and communities. As a result, the Company strongly recommends that all employees be fully vaccinated for Covid-19 and keep up to date with Covid-19 boosters.
  

  

BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area.  

  

If you live in or expect to work from Los Angeles County if hired for this position, please visit this page for important additional information: https://careers.bms.com/california-residents/

title: Executive Associate, Purpose/ESG/Health Equity and GPS Communications
description:
**Working with Us**  

Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren't words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You'll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.  

  

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us .  

  

**Position Summary**  

  

The Executive Associate will support the Purpose, ESG, and Health Equity as well as the GPS Communications function. The ideal candidate must possess the ability to work efficiently and effectively in a fast-paced and high-pressure environment. You must understand the importance of discretion and confidentiality and maintain a high level of professionalism, common sense and keen awareness of day-to-day operations.
  

  

This role requires the ability to complete high volumes of complex tasks and projects quickly with little-to-no guidance. The highest standards of written and verbal skills are required, as is a diligent and detail-orientated attitude.  

  

You must have a relentless bias for action, a great ability to effectively communicate at all levels, and be highly organized with exceptional project management skills. You will manage complex calendars, coordinate international and domestic travel, process expense reports, assist with project support, and act as a general liaison between team members and leadership.  

  

This role is highly visible in the organization and requires an individual who is well organized, compassionate, responsive, discreet and thorough. Priorities can often change in a fast-paced and dynamic environment like ours, so this role includes maintaining dynamic schedules and doing so with tremendous attention to detail and proactiveness.  

  

**In this role, you will:*** Proactively coordinate and engage with leadership in planning activities, calendars and the organization of events (such as staff meeting agenda and other high-profile events).
* Track and help drive completion of key deliverables and follow up on outstanding items.
* Own programs and projects in various areas across our Purpose, ESG and Health Equity teams as well as GPS Communications.
* Interact comfortably with senior management, all levels of staff within the company as well as external stakeholders.
* Ensure timely prioritization and track tasks all the way through to completion.
* Manage domestic and international travel logistics (mobile technology, passport, visa requirements etc.) and handle travel schedule, meeting details, etc.
* Maintain expenses. Collect all documentation to identify appropriate path to complete reimbursements.
* Process purchase orders and invoices; order departmental equipment and supplies.

**Minimum Requirements:*** 10+ years of administrative support experience.
* Most importantly, proactive, a caring teammate and a strong support advocate.
* Demonstrated ability to quickly gain and maintain trust.
* Validated ability to provide confidentiality and discretion, and act with excellent judgment.
* Strong organizational skills, detail-orientation, and extraordinary prioritization and multi-tasking.
* Very proficient with Microsoft Office, particularly Outlook, Excel, and PowerPoint.
* Flexible with ability to handle multiple tasks efficiently.
* Highly positive demeanor and style; improves team and company culture with each interaction.

title: Full-time Medical Assistant / Receptionist for Urgent Care
description:
At **Doral Health & Wellness**, we are proud of our commitment to the Brooklyn, New York Community to provide integrated interdisciplinary health services in an innovative medical facility dedicated to the health and well-being of our patients.

We are seeking a **Medical Assistant** with receptionist experience to join our supportive and encouraging team!

**Responsibilities:**

* Helps patients by providing information, services, and assistance.
* Maintains medical supplies inventory and performs preventive maintenance to keep medical equipment operating by following operating instructions, troubleshooting breakdowns, maintaining supplies, performing preventive maintenance, and calling for repairs.
* Verifies patient information by interviewing patients, recording medical history, and confirming the purpose of the visit.
* Prepares patients for examination by performing preliminary physical tests; taking blood pressure, weight, and temperature; and reporting patient history summary.
* Saves doctors’ time by helping with office procedures.
* Secures patient information and maintains patient confidence by completing and safeguarding medical records; completing diagnostic coding and procedure coding; and keeping patient information confidential.
* Counsel patients by transmitting physician’s orders and questions about surgery.
* Schedules surgeries by making arrangements with the surgical center; verifying times with patients; and preparing charts and pre-admission and consent forms.
* Maintains a safe, secure, and healthy work environment by establishing and following standards and procedures and complying with legal regulations.
* Keep supplies ready by monitoring inventory stock, placing orders, and verifying receipts.
* Keeps up to date with industry best practice
* Serves and protects the practice by adhering to professional standards; facility policies and procedures; and federal, state, and local requirements.

**Qualifications:**

* Medical Assistant Certification
* Previous experience as a Medical Receptionist
* 2-3 years of experience in a medical office
* Experience with EMR (electronic medical records), medical terminology
* Excellent verbal & written communication skills.
* Bilingual in Spanish preferred.

**Compensation:**

* Pay rate is $24 per hour depending on experience
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Holiday Pay
* Dental insurance
* 401(k)
* Vision insurance
* Life insurance
* Disability insurance
* Other

title: Health Center Manager - Bronx, NY
description:
At Planned Parenthood of Greater New York (PPGNY), our greatest strengths are the employees who empower every individual with the information, resources, and care they need to live happy, healthy lives.

Picture yourself here: We are a team of trusted health care providers, educators, and fierce advocates committed to advancing equity and improving health outcomes in communities that face systemic barriers to quality, innovative sexual and reproductive health services - including birth control, pregnancy testing, emergency contraception, cancer screenings, STI testing and treatment, HIV testing and prevention, transgender hormone therapy, wellness exams, crisis counseling, and financial counseling. PPGNY also proudly provides compassionate, nonjudgmental abortion services.  

When you join PPGNY as a Health Center Manager you will assume responsibility for managing all aspects of the financial and clinical operations of the Health Center(s), in collaboration with Health Center Director/VP of Clinical Operations.
### **Additional responsibilities include:**

* Maintaining efficient staffing levels and appropriate skills for optimum flow
* Establishes and maintains a caring and professional atmosphere in the health center that provides customer focused service delivery and meets productivity and patient load goals
* Supervises center workflow to ensure timely completion of tasks
* Keeps Health Center Director/Vice President of Health Center Operations informed of progress and problems
* Responsible to creating staff schedules and patient appointment templates, Holds daily huddles (or delegates) to assure that communication of new information and the daily schedule and staffing are clear to all staff
* Serves as leader within the center to foster teamwork and positive attitudes among staff in accomplishing the goals and objectives of the agency
* Undertakes an analysis of data to evaluate center achievement on customer service and financial goals. Analyzes trends and make adjustments to health center operations and finances accordingly
* Collaborates with clinical services to assure highest level productivity is reached in his/her center while maintaining quality of patient care
* Builds a successful health center team and communicates regularly and effectively, including making proactive suggestions to Health Center Director/Vice President of Health Center Operations
* Hires and supervises center support staff and volunteers as appropriate. Serves as an on-site resource and assures compliance with all regulatory bodies
* Directly supervises (which includes hiring, orienting, training, reviewing, and terminating, if needed) all staff in the health center
* Routinely reviews and analyzes reports of service visits, budgets, billing, entitlement program enrollments, finances and other performance measurements as directed the Health Center Director/VP of Health Center Operations. Provides feedback and prepares corrective action when needed
* Oversees financial and risk management activities including depositing and reporting of receipts and maintenance of internal controls and appropriate safety measures
* Responds to after-hour emergencies, e.g., power failure, fire alarm, burglar alarm

### **You have:**

* High school diploma/GED
* Previous experience working in a high-volume health care setting
* 2 years of supervisory experience

### **What makes you stand out:**

* Bachelor’s Degree or higher in related field
* Previous experience working with electronic health records
* Proficiency in other languages
* Prior Planned Parenthood employment

**PPGNY's benefits package includes:**
Generous PTO and holiday schedule
Medical, dental and vision coverage options for you and eligible dependents
FSA, HSA, Commuter pre-tax reimbursement funds
Short and Long Term Disability, Free Basic Life and AD&D
401(k) Retirement Plan with Safe Harbor contributions after 1 year of employment**All positions at PPGNY require:**
Proof of immunization or immunity to certain communicable diseases (including influenza during the flu season and Covid-19) and testing for tuberculosis. These certifications are required by the NYC DOHMH Health Code, NYSDOH and OSHA.  

Planned Parenthood of Greater New York (PPGNY) is a leading provider, educator, and advocate of sexual and reproductive health care in New York State. PPGNY is proud to provide a wide-range of family planning services at our 22 health centers and mobile care units. We care for everyone regardless of their immigration status, zip code or ability to pay. PPGNY’s education and outreach programs are backed by medically-accurate, evidence-based information that allows people to make informed decisions about their health and future. As a voice for reproductive freedom, PPGNY supports legislation and policies that ensure all New Yorkers have access to the full range of reproductive health care and education.  

At PPGNY, we provide the absolute best care to our patients and our communities through innovative health care delivery and education programming. We care for everyone who walks through our doors regardless of insurance, ability to pay or immigration status. As a leading voice for reproductive freedom, PPGNY fiercely advocates for policies to ensure that all New Yorkers will have access to the full range of reproductive health care services and information.  

PPGNY is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe we are most impactful when people with a wide range of backgrounds, experiences, and identities come together with common purpose. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

title: Retail Key Holder
description:
**COME JOIN THE PARTY**

At Party City, we create joy for our customers by making it easy to create unforgettable memories. We are Customer Obsessed. Our **Key Holders**lead by example and possess the energy and enthusiasm to match our customers’ excitement while providing an exceptional shopping experience. We are knowledgeable about our products and services because we have the broadest and best selection of party goods in the industry. We ensure we are in-stock and easy to shop. We inspire our customers with exciting concepts, themes, ideas and provide everything they need to bring their party to life. At PCHI, our promise is Customer First, People Matter, It Can Be Done and Celebrate! We live our brand every day and love to party!

**ARE YOU CUSTOMER OBSESSED?**

At Party City we celebrate each season, holiday, and event with our customers. Our **Key Holders** are responsible for fostering a fun environment and customer obsessed culture. If you have a celebratory spirit, then we need you.

We show *empathy* and create a connection with every customer by offering a friendly greeting and welcoming smile. “Welcome to the Party!!!”

We *listen* to each customer and ask relevant questions to determine the appropriate solution for their event.

We *resolve* simple and complex customer issues daily.

Party City loves *balloons*! We use our personalized creativity to design balloon décor and bouquets for every holiday and occasion.

We celebrate *birthdays* every day.

Our entire team creates *joy* for our customers by providing quality products and services. We bring the customers party vision to life!

**WHAT DO YOU BRING TO THE PARTY?**

If you can answer **YES**to the questions below then this is the job for you!

Do you possess prior retail experience?

Can you lead others in a fast-paced environment?

Are you helpful, passionate, and fun?

Can you inspire and serve others?

Are you adaptable and able to manage change?

Are you results driven?

Are you dependable and committed?

Do you enjoy planning parties and events?

**RESULTS MATTER**

Key Holders ensure our store is always customer ready, and are responsible for the following:

Open/Close the store (alarm activation/deactivation)

Count and prepare tills for store opening.

Count and balance tills at end of day.

Prepare deposit, count safe.

Perform customer service interventions at registers, including price overrides, discounts, refunds, exchanges, and other manual adjustments as needed.

Perform Leader on Duty (LOD) function only when Store Team Leader or Team Leader is absent.

Review and validate that Daily Party Plan tasks are completed as assigned when performing LOD functions.

Solve customer related issues when performing LOD role.

Execute any Emergency Response procedures as needed when acting in the LOD function.

Receiving Freight and filling out daily log – Maintaining receiving procedure.

Balloon orders prepped for next day.

Recovery and cleaning of store (Sales floor/counter/Backroom/breakroom/Bathroom and office).

Daily scan audit (opening)

Communication review on Party Central, reading and reacting to emails and text threads.

Frequent kneeling, bending, and stooping.

Standing for long periods throughout schedule day

**PARTY PERKS AND REWARDS**

We value our associate’s loyalty and commitment to the organization. Full-time team members enjoy:

Comprehensive Benefit Plan

401(K) Program

Tuition Reimbursement

Competitive hourly wage

Fun working environment

Flexible scheduling

Relaxed dress code

30% discount

Work Life balance, no late nights, and closed Thanksgiving, Christmas and Easter

Lifestyle benefits

title: Chiropractic Internship/Associate
description:
\\*\\*Overview:\\*\\*

We are a multidisopnary health center seeking a chiropractor to join our team.

Our ideal candidate is a chiropractic student, or newly licensed chiropractor seeking a long term position.

Our providers play a vital role in providing exceptional patient care and assisting in the diagnosis and treatment of various musculoskeletal and nervous system disorders. Your expertise will be essential in helping patients achieve optimal health and wellness.

\\*\\*Duties:\\*\\*

- Conduct thorough patient examinations to identify areas of discomfort and potential issues.

- Utilize your extensive knowledge of physiology and anatomy to develop personalized treatment plans.

- Administer chiropractic techniques to alleviate pain and discomfort.

- Perform physical examinations and provide detailed diagnoses to patients.

- Develop and implement treatment plans for patients suffering from acute pain.

- Interpret medical imaging results to inform treatment decisions.

- Manage pain effectively, using a multidisciplinary approach that includes chiropractic care, physical therapy, and other forms of treatment.

- Educate patients on proper posture, body mechanics, and lifestyle habits to promote optimal health and wellness.

- Maintain accurate and detailed patient records, including medical history, treatment plans, and progress updates.

- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure seamless patient care.

- Stay current with the latest advancements in chiropractic care and medical research.

\\*\\*Qualifications:\\*\\*

- Doctor of Chiropractic (DC) degree or equivalent (may be in progress; students are welcome to apply).

- Active licensure to practice chiropractic care in the state or region where the position is located.

- Strong knowledge of medical terminology and anatomy.

- Ability to diagnose and treat a wide range of musculoskeletal and nervous system disorders.

- Experience in occupational health and acute pain management is a plus.

- Familiarity with medical imaging technologies, including X-rays and MRIs.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Compassionate and patient-centered approach to care.

- Commitment to ongoing education and professional development.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship

Pay: $50,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year

* Physical & Rehabilitation Medicine
* Sports Medicine

title: Real Estate Agent
description:
**Thinking of becoming a real estate agent ? We help you get licensed.**

Highline Residential has 400 agents and it is the #1 fastest and independently owned and operated real estate brokerage in NYC with 3 offices in the metro area. We are data-driven and technology-focused and offer new agents a number of advantages, including:

* In-depth new agent training
* Full time or part time opportunities
* A supportive and collaborative work environment
* Opportunities to work on exclusive listings and deals
* A chance to learn from and work with top-performing real estate agents

If you are interested in getting licensed as a real estate salesperson and building a successful career in the industry, Highline Residential is a great place to start.

Here are some of the key benefits of working at Highline Residential for new agents:

* You will receive comprehensive training on all aspects of the real estate business, from marketing and sales to closing deals.
* You will have access to the latest technology and tools to help you succeed, including a cutting-edge real estate software platform and a database of exclusive listings.
* You will be supported by a team of experienced agents who are committed to your success.
* You will have the opportunity to work on exclusive listings and deals, which can help you earn more money and build your reputation.
* You will have the chance to learn from and work with top-performing real estate agents, who can teach you the secrets of success in the industry.

If you are serious about getting licensed as a real estate salesperson and building a successful career, Highline Residential is a great place to start.

**NOTE:**

* **Must be licensed or enrolled in a 77 hour real estate salesperson licensing course, mandated by NYS.**

Chaleureuse, car l’humain est notre première richesse, notre façon d’être ensemble est primordiale. Nous nourrissons des relations simples, sympathiques, basées sur la solidarité, la proximité et l’inclusivité de tous.
Inspirée, grâce à la créativité permanente au service de nos clients, qui nous fait avancer toujours plus loin depuis 25 ans.
Durable, car engagés dans des causes environnementales et citoyennes, nous prônons l’égalité des chances et le développement de chacun à l'ouverture au monde.
Maisons du Monde souhaite devenir la marque de préférence la plus désirable et durable d’Europe du secteur ameublement/déco.

Notre magasin recrute un/e Assistant/e Polyvalent/e.
Vos missions en magasin au sein de l’équipe :

Être acteur dans la réussite de votre magasin* Connaître les indicateurs commerciaux de votre magasin et appliquer, avec les managers et l’équipe, les plans d’action pour atteindre les objectifs

Ouvert à tous les Talents du Monde, l’ensemble de nos postes sont handi-accueillants et répondent aux critères de la Charte de Diversité, dont nous sommes fiers d’être adhérent.
A bientôt pour partager une nouvelle aventure ensemble !

title: Assistant General Counsel – Discovery & Records
description:
Cooley is seeking an Assistant General Counsel – Discovery & Records to work as part of a team in the General Counsel’s Office.
Position summary: Guided by department objectives and priorities, the Assistant General Counsel - Discovery & Records will work closely with the Office of the General Counsel in managing the legal affairs of the firm, with a primary focus on client file transfers and discovery related to firm matters. This includes responding to subpoenas, discovery requests, and file transfer requests that require legal counsel review and analysis of firm records and information. The Assistant General Counsel - Discovery & Records will also be responsible for implementing preservation holds for the firm. The role requires strong collaboration skills to build strong relationships internally and externally to drive accurate, time-sensitive results. Specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:
Position responsibilities:* Handle discovery related to internal firm matters including advising the Office of the General Counsel, partners, associates and business professionals on internal discovery and compliance processes
* Prepare responses to discovery requests and subpoenas, and assist with internal investigations related to internal firm matters
* Meet and confer with requesting parties regarding scope of discovery responses
* Implement review and response processes in collaboration with the firm’s Office of the General Counsel, Information Governance department and Litigation/eDiscovery department
* Collaborate with the firm’s Information Governance department to manage data preservation, collection, and review protocols
* Manage the firm’s implementation and resolution of legal holds, including drafting/review/revision of preservation hold memos in collaboration with the firm’s Office of the General Counsel and Information Governance department
* Oversee the scoping and review of information gathered from firm files for use in discovery, responses to subpoenas and file transfer obligations in collaboration with the firm’s Office of the General Counsel, Information Governance department and the Litigation/eDiscovery department
* Work closely with the firm’s litigation/eDiscovery department regarding project management, review of resources and process, as well as vendor costs and management
* Work closely with the Office of General Counsel and the Information Governance department to update the firm’s policies, procedures, and practices related to client file transfers and related functions
* Provide guidance to and assist with oversight of the firm’s file review attorneys to ensure appropriate review and transfer of client files
* Coordinate with outside counsel on the discovery process as necessary
* Assist with discovery motion practice, including drafting briefs
* Work with firm management, partners, outside counsel, and relevant administrative departments to establish appropriate policies, practices, and procedures related to discovery of firm information
* Support the Office of General Counsel in ensuring internal stakeholders align with legal processes and procedures
* Keep current on developments in law and regulation regarding discovery and law firm risk management and other issues
* Provide strategic legal guidance, including strong applied litigation practice expertise to internal teams on litigation, pre-litigation, and other loss prevention and risk management matters
* Ensure internal client service and satisfaction are attained in all areas of position
* Identify litigation risks to the firm, report those to the Office of the GC and formulate an effective response to those risks
* Assist in the development and implementation of strategic plans and specific projects for risk management
* Provide support to the other lawyers in the Office of the General Counsel as requested
* All other duties as assigned or required


Skills and experience:
Required:* After orientation at Cooley LLP, exhibit proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite, iManage and other firm applications
* Ability to work extended and/or weekend hours, as required
* 5+ years managing discovery, including eDiscovery projects, for complex litigation matters and strong litigation practice skills
* JD from an ABA accredited law school
* Active member in good standing of the jurisdiction in which the attorney is resident and the jurisdiction of the Cooley office to which the attorney is assigned
* Experience as a litigation attorney managing discovery, including eDiscovery projects, for complex litigation matters
* Experience with relational document review databases such as Relativity
* Strong knowledge of key discovery concepts, procedural rules, processes, and litigation practices
* After orientation at Cooley LLP, exhibit proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite, iManage, 3E and other firm applications
* Ability to work extended and/or weekend hours, as required
* Ability to travel, as required


Preferred:* Prior experience in law firm risk management as well as project management
* Experience with legal ethics and privilege issues
* General understanding of data privacy regulations and principles


Competencies:* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to exchange information and to present ideas, report facts and other information clearly and concisely
* Ability to analyze needs and to determine priorities based on business objectives
* Strong sense of accountability
* Ability to communicate effectively and diplomatically with all levels of the firm’s professional staff members and attorneys, both in 1:1 and group environments
* Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build working relationships at all levels of management and across departments
* A creative and practical approach to problem solving that is informed by the firm’s strategic, business and professional needs
* Team-oriented, with excellent counseling, organizational and analytical skills
* A commitment to maintain the highest level of confidentiality, personal integrity, ethics and dedication.
* The ability to work well under pressure and handle numerous responsibilities simultaneously with diligence while providing practical, business-driven advice
* Sound professional ethics and integrity
* High emotional intelligence and cultural sensitivity.
* Strong legal research and analysis abilities, as well as comprehensive writing skills


Cooley offers a competitive compensation and excellent benefits package and is committed to fair and equitable employment practices.
The expected annual pay range for this position with a work schedule of 40 hours per week is $200,000 - $260,000. Please note that final offer amount will be dependent on geographic location, applicable experience and skillset of the candidate.
We offer a full range of elective benefits including medical, health savings account (with applicable medical plan), dental, vision, health and/or dependent care flexible spending accounts, pre-tax commuter benefits, life insurance, AD&D, long-term care coverage, backup care for children and/or adults and other parental support benefits. In addition to elective benefit options, benefited employees receive firm-paid life insurance, AD&D, LTD, short term medical benefits as well as four weeks of vacation, two weeks of sick and 10 paid holidays each year. We provide generous parental leave and fertility benefits. New employees will attend a detailed benefit orientation to learn more about our many benefits and resources.

title: Clinical Assistant/Medical Assistant (Full-Time)
description:
At Doral Health & Wellness, we are dedicated to providing exceptional integrated interdisciplinary health services to the Brooklyn community. Our innovative medical facility is committed to enhancing the health and well-being of our patients through comprehensive and compassionate care.

We are currently seeking a dynamic **Clinical Assistant/Medical Assistant** to join our team on a full-time basis. This role is essential in supporting our providers and ensuring the seamless delivery of patient care.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Provider Follow-Up:** Assist with tasks that require follow-up with providers, including managing prescription issues, obtaining additional clinical information from insurance companies or diagnostic imaging facilities, and arranging provider-to-provider communication.
* **Patient Screenings:** Complete patient screenings such as Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) and Patient Health Questionnaire (PQ 9).
* **Diagnostic Testing:** Perform spirometry and Retinavue exams to support patient diagnostics.
* **Clinical Tasks:** Conduct EKGs, phlebotomy, and lab processing to ensure accurate and timely results.
* **Inventory Management:** Maintain and organize medical inventory to ensure that all necessary supplies are readily available.

**Qualifications:**

* Experience as a Clinical Assistant or Medical Assistant is preferred.
* Proficiency in performing clinical tasks, including EKGs, phlebotomy, and lab processing.
* Ability to manage follow-up tasks and communicate effectively with insurance companies and diagnostic facilities.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Commitment to delivering high-quality patient care and support.

**Compensation:**

* Pay rate is $24 per hour
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Holiday Pay
* Dental insurance
* 401(k)
* Vision insurance
* Life insurance
* Disability insurance
* Other

title: Home Health Aide
description:
**Certified Home Health Aide ($18.55-$21.09 an hour)**


**Job Description**


**UniversaCare** is hiring **Certified Home Health Aides/Personal Care Assistants** to do home care visits.


**About Us**



UniversaCare is a fully licensed and accredited home care provider serving the NY Metropolitan area and Nassau County for over 12 years. Our mission is to provide compassion and excellence in all aspects of home care as a trusted provider in the community. We offer 24 hours a day, 7 days a week quality care, including personal care and companionship.


**Available Positions**



Full-Time & Part-Time (Flexible)


**Start Date**



Immediately!


**Benefits**



Flexible hours/scheduling



Weekly direct deposit



Caregiver/client referral bonus



Caregiver of the Month incentives



COVID-19 Precautions



We provide full PPE to our caregiver families (masks, gloves, and hand sanitizer).


**Job Requirements**



Work with patients of all ages that require care in their homes



Must be able to carry out patient care plan activities



Must be a caring, patient, and compassionate caregiver



Be willing to accompany patients to doctor’s office


**Qualifications**



Valid HHA (Home Health Aide) or PCA (Personal Care Assistant) certificate



Up-to-date physical and medical information (within the last 12 months)



Assist clients with personal care, including dressing, mobility, medication reminders, personal hygiene, and eating



Document and report any changes in client's health status



Ensure highest client safety and well-being



Driving preferred but not a must



Education



Must be able to read and speak the English language. Bilingual HHAs and PCAs are encouraged to apply!



Contact **UniversaCare** today:



(718) 224-3758 ext. 2 Please leave a voicemail, and we’ll call you back!



If you are thinking about obtaining an HHA certificate or think you would be a good fit with our company culture, please email us at hello@universacare.com! We look forward to hearing from you.



We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, genetic information, arrest record, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Our management team is dedicated to diversity with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities, and general treatment during employment.

title: Assistant Director of Nursing ADON
RN Staff Educator/Infection Control
description:
**Position:** RN Staff Educator/Infection Control  

**Shift:** Full-Time (Monday - Friday)  

**Salary:** $130,000 per year  

**Department:** Nursing


**About the Role:**



Are you a dedicated Registered Nurse with a strong background in staff education and infection control? We are looking for an RN Staff Educator/Infection Control to enhance our nursing team’s skills, maintain the highest standards of infection prevention, and contribute to a culture of quality and safety.



In this leadership role, you will mentor nursing staff, ensure compliance with regulations, and lead quality initiatives that directly improve resident care. If you’re passionate about fostering learning, maintaining high clinical standards, and promoting infection control, this is the perfect opportunity for you.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Design and lead comprehensive training programs and in-service sessions for nursing staff.
* Oversee orientation programs and ensure staff is up-to-date with best practices and protocols.
* Collaborate with nursing coordinators to provide support across all shifts.
* Manage all aspects of infection prevention, including surveillance, reporting, and staff education.
* Ensure compliance with infection control regulations and implement corrective measures as needed.
* Lead infection control meetings and present data to facility leadership.
* Support the facility's Quality Assurance (QA) program, ensuring high nursing standards and preparedness for regulatory surveys.
* Conduct audits on resident care outcomes, document findings, and implement improvement plans.
* Investigate incidents, report findings, and collaborate on corrective actions.
* Work closely with the Medical Department to develop and maintain effective emergency response protocols.
* Regularly evaluate emergency equipment and ensure staff readiness in emergency situations.


**Requirements:**


* Graduate of an accredited School of Nursing with a current NYS Registered Nurse (RN) license.
* Valid Infection Control Certificate.
* Basic Life Support (BLS) Certification.
* Strong knowledge of infection control practices and nursing regulations.
* A passion for education, leadership, and continuous improvement

title: Housekeeper
description:
Gurwin Healthcare System is a full continuum of care providing extraordinary care and caring to the people that we serve. Set on a 34-acre campus in Commack, NY, the Gurwin Healthcare System includes the 460-bed Gurwin Jewish Nursing & Rehabilitation Center, providing short-term rehabilitation and long-term skilled nursing care, memory care, respiratory and ventilator care, palliative and hospice care, social and medical adult day programs, and on-site dialysis. Sharing the campus is Gurwin’s Assisted Living community (Gurwin Jewish ~ Fay J. Lindner Residences) and Independent Senior Housing.



Gurwin is renowned for its vision in providing the care the community needs while retaining the personalized touch of a much smaller organization, and our growing family of services offer opportunities to advance your career. We are currently seeking a full-time Housekeeper who will be scheduled to work 8:00am-4:00pm with weekend availability.



The housekeeper will be responsible for ensuring the overall cleanliness of Fountaingate Gardens community and residences. Ensures all community areas are kept in an orderly manner, clean, and disinfected to the standards of the community and under guidance from the Executive Director. Establishes and maintains the highest level of standard for community and residential cleanliness.


**Essential Job Functions**



Ø Maintains a professional manner, attitude, and dress at all times. Specifically maintaining a friendly and collaborative demeanor with peers, board members, applicants, guests, residents, and others.



Ø Communicates all information to interested parties, including inter-office, guests, vendors, or others. Must be able to maintain a discreet manner and approach with sensitive or confidential information.



Ø Accurately maintain all resident information while complying with confidentiality as per Gurwin Policy.



Ø Independently able to self-initiate job duties and functions while responding to immediate needs for the benefit of the community.



Ø Demonstrates high-level attention to detail with work completed, immediate workspace, and overall community presentation and cleanliness of all related areas.



Ø Promotes teamwork amongst all supervisory and peer team members while being a positive working environment culture leader.



Ø Performs general housekeeping duties in all community spaces including bathrooms, amenity spaces, and residential units.



Ø Cleans all community spaces as directed or assigned.



Ø Maintains all equipment and supplies needed while communicating defects immediately to the Lead Housekeeper/Director of Environmental Engineering.



Ø Follows all infection control policies while providing input as needed.



Ø Meets all training and on-going education requirements at all times.



Ø Assists in all other departments when needed or as applicable to job duties, to ensure overall resident satisfaction is met and maintained at all times.



Ø Able to manage multiple requests and tasks at a time with varying needs.



Ø Performs all other duties as requested or required.


**Educational Requirements/Qualifications**



Ø High School graduate or equivalent. Ability to understand and follow instructions while demonstrating the ability to communicate effectively with a diverse population.



Ø Must be able to work varying hours and flexible to community needs.

  


**Specific Requirements**



Ø *Complexity*  

Able to plan and prioritize work duties under the direction o the Director of Environmental Engineering while independently initiating all tasks and maintaining a high level of work in a fast-paced environment.



Ø *Confidential* *Information*  

Constant contact with residents, guests, peers, and others requires the ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbally. Must maintain a positive and productive, courteous, and cooperative manner at all times.  

Will be exposed to highly confidential information, demonstrate confidentiality, and only disclose with the Lead Housekeeper/Director of Environmental Engineering or others specifically directed by the Executive Director.  

Able to follow directives from administration or the supervisory team without close supervision.



Ø *Safety*  

Requires ability to read, understand and follow community emergency procedures and all other safety rules, community policies, and regulations.



Ø *Equipment*  

Must operate various levels of housekeeping equipment.



Ø *Working Conditions*  

Clean, well-lighted residential and office environment. Varying levels of noise, activity, and possible interruption. May have exposure to odors, fumes, dust, and cleaning chemicals.


**Physical Requirements**



Ø Must be able to walk/stand for long periods, up to 90% of work time.



Ø Must be able to use telephone and computer for varying periods, up to 100% of work time.



Ø Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 pounds.



Ø Must be able to push and pull up to 200 pounds.



Ø Must be able to stand for varying durations.



Ø Must be able to twist, bend, and walk to maintain walkways and surrounding workspace.


**We offer a comprehensive benefit package.**


**Benefits:**


* Medical Insurance (Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield) for eligible employees, plus a family option. Includes:



o Fitness Reimbursement Program



o Wellness discounts


* Dental Insurance through MetLife


* Vision Insurance through Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield (EyeMed)


* Accrued holiday/personal and vacation time; payout for unused sick time for those who qualify


* Flexible Spending Account – Medical and/or Dependent Care


* Life Insurance – value is equal to employee’s annual salary (no cost to employee)


* National Employee Assistance Program (no cost to employee)


* Childcare, membership and program discounts at Suffolk YJCC, Commack and Mid-Island YJCC, Plainview


* Tax deferred annuity plan – employee automatically enrolled with 3% contribution / employer contributes 4% after one year of service (graded vesting)


* Tuition Reimbursement up to $5,000 per year


* Employee perks including holiday gift cards, System-wide annual BBQ and Winter Celebrations, meals, treats and other theme related staff events

title: Secretary
company: New Vanderbilt Rehabilitation and Care Center
description:
**Secretary**


**New Vanderbilt Rehabilitation and Care Center** is hiring a **Secretary** for the Social Services Department.


**About us:**



We are a skilled nursing and rehabilitation facility that is dedicated to helping our residents maximize their potential and live their lives to the fullest. We offer a modern, comfortable, and secure facility staffed by caring professionals where individuals receive the finest sub-acute medical care, rehabilitation services, and 24-hour skilled nursing care. We are committed to maintaining a facility where compassionate care is provided in an environment of respect and dignity. It is also a great, supportive working environment for our dedicated staff!


**Position Description:**



The **Secretary** will provide general office support with a variety of clerical activities and related tasks. Responsible for answering incoming calls, directing calls to appropriate departments and employees, mail distribution, flow of correspondence, requisition of supplies when necessary, as well as additional clerical duties.


**Responsibilities of the Secretary:**


* Identify and participate in process improvement initiatives that improve the customer experience, enhance work flow, and/or improve the work environment.
* Answer telephones or switchboard during scheduled shift.
* Ensure phone calls are redirected to appropriate employee or department.
* Transfer callers to appropriate voicemail when employee is unavailable.
* Provide callers with information about the facility, such as, address, directions, fax numbers, facility/Company website and other related information.
* Receive, sort and forward incoming mail.
* Coordinate the pick-up and delivery of express mail services (FedEx, UPS, etc.).
* Assist in the ordering, receiving, stocking and distribution of office supplies.
* Assist with other related clerical duties, such as, copying, faxing, filing, etc., as needed.


**Requirements of the Secretary:**


* High school diploma or GED required or equivalent related work experience.


* Excellent phone etiquette skills required.


* Effective verbal and written English communication skills.


* Demonstrated basic to intermediate skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook, Internet and Intranet navigation.


* Highest level of professionalism with the ability to maintain confidentiality.


* Customer service oriented with the ability to work well under pressure.

title: Manager, Supply Chain Transport Warehouse Operations
description:
**Summary**

This position is responsible to ensure performance to plan against quantified objectives including cost, customer service, safety, asset utilization and productivity. Responsible for facilitating action plans required for successful execution of goals through standard key performance indicators, monthly operating reviews and to take timely corrective actions to ensure continuous improvement in all transportation strategies and tactics.

**Responsibilities**

* Effectively measure and manage on-time cost effective movement for all company owned transportation activates including select inbound raw materials from suppliers to plant, finished goods between plants and distribution centers, select customer direct ship and the return of dunnage to plants and suppliers as needed.
* Oversee the effective execution of an inbound and outbound transportation program that maximizes asset utilization and vehicle capacity through company owned and operated equipment while meeting service requirements between select suppliers, plants, distribution centers and select customers.
* Ensure compliance to safety, regulatory, compliance, and DOT requirements for all company owned and operating vehicles and associated drivers relative to hours of service, clean driving record, legal load limits
* Develop and standardize specifications for company owned equipment in conjunction with market execution imperatives, procurement, safety, fleet and Transportation leadership that maximize legal load limits
* Benchmark best in class Transportation operations and launch innovative transportation initiatives to close performance gaps to maximize capacity and utilization of all transportation assets in order to reduce costs including continuous movements, stop off in transit, hot seating all equipment that is running equipment 20 hours per day and matching outbound finished goods and inbound raw material movements to minimize empty miles.
* Meet budgeted cost and advice on capital requests related to transportation assets.
* Ensure contingency policies/programs are in place with alternate service providers in order to ensure continuity of supply or address unexpected threats to supply chain fulfillment.
* Evaluate, make business case and if needed deploy transportation management systems or enhancements that enhance on-time performance, visibility through event management, safety performance, and effective routing optimization enabling continuous movement and maximizing asset utilization for transportation network.
* Work cross functionally to ensure efficient and effective execution of Operating Unit and Supply Chain priorities and ensure alignment with senior leadership strategies through consistent and timely communications. Consult with customers, warehouse sales center, planning, sales; production and suppliers in order to improve transportation performance, (e.g., direct ship, quality improvement).
* Partners with leaders, employees, and multiple stakeholders to strengthen our safety culture and to develop policies and processes, specific to fleet safety, which protect our most important assets: our employees, our customers, our communities, our brands, and our power units.
* Staff, train, evaluate and develop team members.
* Oversight and management of Production Warehouse & Inventory
* Allocate necessary space for stock rotation.
* Assist and maintain appropriate inventory levels and product loss control.
* Oversee shipping and receiving functions as applicable.
* Secure company assets.

**Qualifications**

**Education** 

* Undergraduate Degree
* University degree in Logistics Management, Engineering or Business preferred.
* MBA or advanced degree a plus.

**Experience** 

* At least 7 years
* Experience in the beverage/food or pharmaceutical industries strongly desired.
* Must have experience in large scale transportation operations including multiple tiers of employees.
* Experience managing in a collective bargaining agreement environment strongly preferred.
* Strong knowledge of inventory management systems.
* Forklift certification a plus.
* Previous experience managing supervisory level employees preferred.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $95,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Elmsford, NY 10523 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Elmsford, NY 10523: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Full-time Medical Assistant (MA) Multiple Sites
description:
At **Doral Health & Wellness**, we are proud of our commitment to the Brooklyn, New York Community to provide integrated interdisciplinary health services in an innovative medical facility dedicated to the health and well-being of our patients.

We are seeking a **Floating Medical Assistant** to join our supportive and encouraging team!

***NOTE***: This position requires accompanying an MD and traveling to other sites within Brooklyn.

**Responsibilities:**

* Helps patients by providing information, services, and assistance.
* Maintains medical supplies inventory and performs preventive maintenance to keep medical equipment operating by following operating instructions, troubleshooting breakdowns, maintaining supplies, performing preventive maintenance, and calling for repairs.
* Verifies patient information by interviewing patients, recording medical history, and confirming the purpose of the visit.
* Prepares patients for examination by performing preliminary physical tests; taking blood pressure, weight, and temperature; and reporting patient history summary.
* Saves doctors’ time by helping with office procedures.
* Secures patient information and maintains patient confidence by completing and safeguarding medical records; completing diagnostic coding and procedure coding; and keeping patient information confidential.
* Counsel patients by transmitting physician’s orders and questions about surgery.
* Schedules surgeries by making arrangements with the surgical center; verifying times with patients; and preparing charts and pre-admission and consent forms.
* Maintains a safe, secure, and healthy work environment by establishing and following standards and procedures and complying with legal regulations.
* Keep supplies ready by monitoring inventory stock, placing orders, and verifying receipts.
* Keeps up to date with industry best practice
* Serves and protects the practice by adhering to professional standards; facility policies and procedures; and federal, state, and local requirements.

**Qualifications:**

* Medical Assistant Certification
* 2-3 years of experience in a medical office
* Experience with EMR (electronic medical records), medical terminology
* Excellent verbal & written communication skills.
* Bilingual in Spanish preferred.

**Compensation:**

* Pay rate is $23 per hour depending on experience
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Holiday Pay
* Dental insurance
* 401(k)
* Vision insurance
* Life insurance
* Disability insurance
* Other

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**Executive Assistant**



New Hyde Park, NY

  


**About Us:** With 50 years of dedicated service to our communities, Personal Touch has been a trusted provider of home care. Our priority lies in ensuring exemplary patient care while fostering a supportive and empowering workplace culture for all team members.


**Why Choose Us**: At Personal-Touch Home Care, we are committed to creating a rewarding and fulfilling experience for our team members. Our established history and reputation provide a stable and trusted foundation for your career. Join us in positively impacting the lives of our patients and their families. As a member of our team, you will enjoy a wide range of benefits that enhance your overall well-being and support your career growth. They include:


* Employee Recognition Programs: We acknowledge and celebrate your contributions.


* Comprehensive Health Benefits: We offer an inclusive package with Medical, Dental, Vision, Accident, and Long-Term Disability Coverage to ensure access to quality medical care while promoting overall wellness.


* Generous Paid Time Off: We provide generous paid time off to ensure you can recharge and return to work refreshed, leading to greater productivity and job satisfaction. We support a healthy work-life balance.


* Retirement Benefits: We offer a 401k plan to secure your financial future and help you save for retirement.


* Life Insurance: We offer company paid life insurance providing peace of mind and financial protection for you and your loved ones.


* Mileage Reimbursement: We make sure you're compensated for your business travel.


* Opportunities for Professional Growth and Development: Empowering you to thrive and grow.


* Employee Assistance Program: Supporting the well-being of you and your family.


* Perks Program: Exclusive deals and offers on products, services, and experiences you need and love.


**Job Summary:** The Executive Assistant provides high-level administrative support to the executive team, ensuring efficient operation and effective management of the executive office. This role involves managing schedules, coordinating meetings, handling communications, and performing a variety of tasks to support the executive's productivity and effectiveness.


**Key Responsibilities:**



* **Administrative Support:**


	+ Manage and maintain executive schedules, including appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements.
	+ Prepare and organize materials for executive meetings, including agendas, presentations, and reports.
	+ Screen and prioritize incoming communications, such as emails, phone calls, and correspondence.
* **Meeting Coordination:**


	+ Schedule and coordinate meetings, conferences, and events, including logistics, catering, and technology setup.
	+ Prepare meeting agendas, take minutes, and follow up on action items.
	+ Keep meticulous notes on meetings and assignments.
	+ Ensure all necessary materials and information are available for meetings.
* **Communication and Liaison:**


	+ Serve as a primary point of contact between the executive and internal/external stakeholders.
	+ Draft, proofread, and edit documents, reports, and presentations for the executive.
	+ Facilitate effective communication within the executive office and across the organization.
	+ Follow up with team members on all deliverables that are expected of them by the CEO.
* **Social Media Management**


	+ Develop and maintain a content calendar, create engaging posts that align with the executive’s or organization’s goals, and ensure consistent messaging across platforms.
	+ Monitor social media interactions, respond to comments and messages, and engage with followers to build and maintain a positive online presence.
	+ Use analytics tools to track the performance of social media efforts, analyze data to refine strategies, and adjust content based on audience insights and engagement metrics.
* **Project Management:**


	+ Assist with special projects, research, and initiatives as directed by the executive.
	+ Track project progress, deadlines, and deliverables, ensuring timely completion.
	+ Coordinate with various departments to gather information and support project execution.
* **Office Management:**


	+ Maintain and organize the executive office, ensuring a professional and efficient environment.
	+ Manage office supplies, equipment, and technology for the executive office.
	+ Handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion and professionalism.
* **Travel Coordination:**


	+ Arrange domestic and international travel, including flights, accommodations, transportation, and itineraries.
	+ Prepare travel expense reports and ensure compliance with company policies.
	+ Address any travel-related issues or changes promptly.
* **Event Planning:**


	+ Organize and coordinate company events, executive retreats, and other special functions.
	+ Manage event budgets, vendors, and logistics to ensure successful execution.
	+ Provide on-site support and troubleshooting during events.
**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Communications, or a related field preferred.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience as an executive assistant or in a similar role.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, **PowerPoint**, Outlook) and other relevant software.
* Excellent organizational, time management, and multitasking skills.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* High level of discretion and confidentiality.
* Professional demeanor and strong interpersonal skills.
* Experience with project management tools and software is a plus.


**Working Conditions:**


* This position typically operates in an office environment.
* May require occasional evening or weekend work to support executive needs.
* Minimal travel may be required for company events or meetings.


**Pay:** $75,000-$100,000


*We are excited to welcome passionate and dedicated individuals to join our team at Personal Touch Home Care. We’re more than just a company, we’re a close-knit family dedicated to supporting each other’s success and well-being. Apply now and join us in making a positive impact on the communities we serve.*

title: (RN) Registered Nurse- Home Care (Full-time or Fee For Service)
company: Personal Touch Home Aides of New York
description:
**(RN) Registered Nurse- Home Care (Full-time or Fee For Service)**



Bronx, NY

  


**About Us:** With over 50 years of dedicated service to our communities, Personal Touch has been a trusted provider of home care and is a leading national home care agency. Our priority lies in ensuring exemplary patient care while fostering a supportive and empowering workplace culture for all team members. We are currently seeking compassionate and skilled professionals to join our team and continue our legacy of providing personalized and attentive care to patients in the comfort of their own home.


**Why Choose Us:** At Personal-Touch Home Care, we are committed to creating a rewarding and fulfilling experience for our team members. Our established history and reputation provide a stable and trusted foundation for your career. Join us in positively impacting the lives of our patients and their families. As a member of our team, you will enjoy a wide range of benefits that enhance your overall well-being and support your career growth. They include:


* **Employee Recognition Programs:** We acknowledge and celebrate your contributions.
* **Comprehensive Health Benefits:** We offer an inclusive package with Medical, Dental, Vision, Accident, and Long-Term Disability Coverage to ensure access to quality medical care while promoting overall wellness.
* **Generous Paid Time Off:** We provide generous paid time off to ensure you can recharge and return to work refreshed, leading to greater productivity and job satisfaction. We support a healthy work-life balance.
* **Retirement Benefits:** We offer a 401k plan to secure your financial future and help you save for retirement.
* **Life Insurance:** We offer company paid life insurance providing peace of mind and financial protection for you and your loved ones.
* **Mileage Reimbursement:** We make sure you're compensated for your business travel.
* **Opportunities for Professional Growth and Development:** Empowering you to thrive and grow.
* **Employee Assistance Program:** Supporting the well-being of you and your family.
* **Perks Program:** Exclusive deals and offers on products, services, and experiences you need and love

  


**JOB SUMMARY**


**Assessment and Care Planning:** Conduct initial and ongoing assessments of patients' health status. Develop and implement individualized care plans based on these assessments to meet the patient's needs.


**Medication Administration:** Administer medications and treatments as prescribed by the physician. Monitor and assess the patient for any adverse reactions or side effects.


**Wound Care:** Provide wound care management, including dressing changes, infection control, and monitoring healing progress.


**Patient Education:** Educate patients and their families about their medical conditions, medications, and treatment plans. Teach them techniques for self-care and management of their health at home.


**Monitoring and Evaluation:** Monitor patients' progress and condition regularly. Evaluate the effectiveness of the care plan and make necessary adjustments based on patient outcomes.


**Collaboration:** Coordinate care with other healthcare professionals, including physicians, therapists, social workers, and home health aides, to ensure comprehensive and integrated care for the patient.


**Documentation:** Maintain accurate and up-to-date medical records and documentation of nursing assessments, interventions, and patient responses.


**Support and Advocacy:** Provide emotional support and advocacy for patients and their families. Ensure patients' rights and preferences are respected throughout their care.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Graduate of an approved school of nursing or Bachelor’s degree of Nursing from an accredited college/university
* Currently licensed, in good standing, to practice in New York as a Registered Nurse.
* Minimum 1 year community health nursing experience or equivalent professional experience.
* Knowledge of nursing and medical practices, procedures, regulations and guidelines pertaining to home care, including OASIS.
* Complies with accepted professional standards and practice.

  


**Job Types:** Fee for Service, Full-time, Part-time


**Pay:** $75-$105 per visit

  


*Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may be required to perform other duties as assigned. Benefits are determined based on availability.*


***We are excited to welcome passionate and dedicated individuals to join our team at Personal Touch Home Care. We’re more than just a company, we’re a close-knit family dedicated to supporting each other’s success and well-being. Apply now and join us in making a positive impact on the communities we serve.***

title: Phlebotomist
description:
**Phlebotomist**


**Centers Laboratory of New Jersey** is actively searching for **Phlebotomists** to for our Laboratory located in **Freehold, NJ.** The ideal candidate will have 2 years of prior experience along with excellent interpersonal skills!


**Reports to:** Phlebotomy Supervisor


*Will work in multiple locations*


**Position Summary:**



Phlebotomists are professionals who specialize in drawing blood from patients. Their responsibilities include interviewing and preparing the patient for the blood draw. They are required to follow strict precautionary safety procedures in order to limit the risk of contact with potentially infectious blood and other bodily fluids.



Record keeping and labeling are also major duties of phlebotomists, to ensure that the right tests are performed on the correct blood specimens.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Accurately identify patients using a wristband, documents or through known visual identification
* Receives assignments, assembles supplies and equipment required to perform specimen collection according to established standards, policies, and procedures
* Accurately identifies priorities such as Stat, timed, or routine
* Determine the right venipuncture method based on patient age, health etc.
* Reassure patients and help them relax
* Find veins that are suitable for puncture
* Draw blood using proper equipment and techniques
* Keep all sharps, needles, and equipment out of reach of the patient and properly dispose of these and all medical waste
* Follow the proper test tube order of draw
* Use appropriate personal protective equipment
* Ensure optimal quality and quantity of samples for the test and tube required
* Label test tubes correctly and send or deliver them for testing
* Does not attempt to draw any patient more than two times and **request help if necessary**
* Answer patient questions and provide useful information
* Keep accurate patient records
* Adhere to all relevant health and safety standards while working
* Monitor the patient for reactions; monitor equipment operations
* Educate patient on immediate aftercare
* Maintain a clean and sanitary space
* If trained on specimen storage and centrifugation, use all appropriate procedures
* Ensure patient confidentiality
* Must be capable of collecting and processing Covid-19 tests
* Attends all required company meetings and training programs


**Requirements:**


* High school degree or equivalent
* Phlebotomy Technician certificate preferred
* Without certificate must have completed a hospital or major lab training program
* Understanding of standard blood drawing practices and procedures
* 2 years proven experience as a phlebotomist
* Good interpersonal skills and communication
* Able and flexible to work nights, evening hours, weekends, holidays, and extended shifts
* Strict adherence to safety regulations, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals
* Knowledge of aseptic and sterilization techniques
* Valid State issued driver’s license with a good driving record
* Adequate automobile insurance
* Vehicle in good driving condition
